titre: Speedy service, ridiculous barriers to filing a claim
comment: Process was smooth and went well after filing the claim. Phone arrived very quickly and service was great. My only complaint is that filing a claim was difficult and frustrating. The instructions required that I turn off ‘Find my iPhone’ which I couldn’t do because my screen was not functional. The claim instructions accounted for this, so I used another device to locate and try to turn it off. It didn’t work because my phone was still online and was not dead. I couldn’t turn it off as the phone was not functional. I removed the phone from my Apple ID and went through the series of required steps multiple times, but nothing worked. The claim form would not allow me to file a claim until Find my Phone was shut off, but no instructions or steps provided how exactly to do this for a phone that was still online and couldn’t be shut off. After trying it on two successive evenings and searching through every instruction and help and FAQ item so could find I finally called Apple and was walked through different instructions on how to wipe the phone entirely. This solved the problem, and I was able to submit a claim form after two days of trying. All went well from there and my replacement arrived the next day. However, the claim process was ridiculously frustrating because the instructions did not account for my situation - which cannot be uncommon amongst folks with a broken phone. Please update your claim instructions to explain the alternate steps needed to wipe a phone that cannot be removed from find my phone — OR, remove this as a requirement to file a claim, as the final instructions I received with the new phone stated again to turn off Find my Phone before I sent in the old device. Which tells me that the step could have been completed after the claim filing instead of as an impediment to filing a claim to begin with.

I bought an "extended warranty plan" from Assurion for my food processor at Walmart. I was told that it was good for two years and that it would cover my food processor after the manufacturer's warranty had expired. My manufacturer's warranty was two years, so I understood that I would end up with four years of coverage. -- WRONG. The coverage from Assurion STARTS when you purchase your product -- since my product already had a two year manufacturer's warranty, I was ripped off and sold a worthless warranty, and neither Walmart or Assurion,(when I called to register my warranty) bothered to tell me this. When I called - two and a half months after the warranty expired -- to file a claim, then they told me that it started on the date of purchase, and that I had bought a worthless warranty and refused to do anything about my broken product. So for my experience, this is a rip off.

This phone is better than the last... but yeah... I wonder if I'd be better saving my $9 a month and buying a phone cash out.

Although I changed the shipping name and address, 1) the system wouldn’t allow me to enter a room number and 2) despite changing the ship to name, and it showing her name on the confirmation, the Fed Ex label was addressed to my husband. The hotel had been warned to hold the package for her, and they almost returned it because my husband wasn’t listed as a guest.

I called and they asked me to verify information they already had and asking me questions about my past. They said would get a tracking number in a couple of hours, which I never got. I called in and the phone system gave me a tracking number. Hope the phone is programmed correctly. If it comes correct, it will be almost a week before I get my replacement that should have come in 1-2 days. I have had insurance with them for years, and this is the service I get.

titre: I would not recommend this insurance to…
comment: I would not recommend this insurance to anyone. I have been dealing with this company since March 4th and it is now April 6th. My original phone had very minor problems with occasional glitching but I thought since I had the insurance I minds well use it. After charging me to get a screen replacement and that not working, they sent me a phone that after a day or two had even worse issues than the original. After a week of trying to run through tests to prove that this very old refurbished phone was faulty they finally sent me a new one and this phone was even worse. In between all of this I also had issues with phones I sent back getting lost in the mail but then after a very stressful week of talking to usps, finally finding it. Having to call at least 30 times over the last month and reexplain my situation to every person has made this experience more frustrating than you could imagine and not having a functional phone to top it off makes it even worse. I had to drive hours to the closest apple store to now try and fix what they told me was a 5 year old refurbished phone that has been completely unusable due to the out of focus camera, glitching gps, and eventually completely blacked out screen. This company needs to be sending out good quality phones, if not better than what I originally had. Not to mention I am out hundreds of dollars trying to fix problems with this new phone just to have something remotely close to what I started with. I am highly disappointed and refuse to seek help through this company ever again.

Today is now April 5th and I am still without a phone. I have a child in school and they have no way to contact me because I am left without a phone. This isn't the half of my anger with this company because of their lack of communication. ATT needs to find a new 3rd Party because they are never getting my business again after this.

titre: This company is one of the worst ones
comment: This company is one of the worst ones. The people on the phones are very disrespectful and mean to me, and do not care about the customers at all. I bought a dryer with a warranty of five years and it has been with us for two years. Then, it ripped and discolored our clothes. It ruined lots of my clothes, ripping out many jackets along with pajamas . I complained about it calling them hundreds of time. They were very mean and disrespectful to me. They did not want to get me a new one, although I showed the receipt along with the warranty to them emailing them everything. Moreover, I called them after that saying that they received. They agreed that they have it but do not wanna get me a new dryer.I mailed them the receipt seven times. The replied to me saying literally “ I do not care about you”. How disrespectful is that ? titre: I sent my phone off to get a very tiny crack
comment: I sent my phone off to get a very tiny crack towards the top of my iPhone fixed. They sent it back not fixed. Then I plugged it in and turned it on to find that my home button was broken. I called and they told me that they never touched it but plugged it in and it was showing errors so they just sent it back to me. So I had to spend $125 to get a replacement phone. I tried to explain to a couple different people that this wasn’t a problem when I sent it in. They told me there was nothing they would do for me. So I was not a happy customer. However I got my replacement phone the next day. I think they broke my phone and just shipped it back to me to be honest.
Great response.  Did everything as promised.

Claim last Wednesday 3/27 around 5pm. Technically I should have had a phone 3/28 Thursday. I gave it until 3/29 before I started to get worried. Its now 4/3/19 and I have no phone, no tracking number. I have spoken with a different rep on Friday, Monday, twice on Tuesday and now again tonight. I continue to be given the run around. Everyday I am told my replacement phone will arrive the next day, nothing. Yesterday I was told it was being processed manually and would be 3 to 5 business days Wait? WHAT? Why? I was told I would get an email with my tracking number... no email. I called tonight and she tells me again that it will ship tomorrow? Why isn't someone putting the phone in the box and making sure that it goes next day air? You have had my $100 co-pay for a week now, I need a phone. To top it off, after I asked to speak to a supervisor this evening, she refused after keeping me on hold for 15 minutes and when I stated again that I asked to speak to a supervisor directly myself and she hung up on me. NOT COOL Asurion. I want a refund, I can go buy a new phone.

titre: This is my second review now.
comment: This is my second review now.. i have been waiting for a replacement device for over a month now. My phone got stolen so Asurion sent me a refurbished device, this device malfunctions on the daily: dropped calls, slow data, and texts sometimes will not send. I have called them almost 20 times now for the new device to get shipped out and everytime they tell me the same thing, “Alex, your device is on the way and should be there between 2-3 business days. We apologize for the inconvenience and know how important your phone is to you”. No you don’t!! If you did I would have have my replacement device by now. And I’m sure they will comment on this review telling me they want to look further into the situation and to send them an email or go on their website. Every time I call I ask for the shipping information of the new phone but then they explain they can’t give it to me until the device is shipped.. so then I land in the same spot I was before because the phone never gets shipped out. Let’s see how long this actullay takes for me to receive the phone, it’s already been over month going on two now. Asurion is a pain to deal with, definitely do NOT recommend them to anybody. And what’s even worse is that Asurion is the insurance provider for almost every cellular company so there’s no way out of using them. Someone needs to invest in a phone insurance company, that way were not stuck using Asurion.

titre: First experience with them replacing my…
comment: First experience with them replacing my phone was fine, until the replacement abruptly shut down and wouldn't restart. Since then, dealing with Asurion has been nothing but problems. The second replacement sent out was a much older phone that could not be described as a "comparable device" in any way other than it was made by the same manufacturer. When this device started to malfunction, I called for yet another replacement, asking for a device more comparable to the phone that was originally covered. They agreed to send a Samsung s7, but there was never any follow up. Several weeks later I called to find out what was going on, only to find out that the latest replacement was cancelled without any explanation or notification. They now refuse to honour the agreement for the Samsung, refused to explain why the replacement was cancelled, why they refuse to honthe previous agreement or explain how the older phone they sent last time is more comparable to my original phone that was covered than the S7. We have yet to see if this defective phone will be replaced or if I'll be charged a replacement fee again.

I thought my coverage was paid for and no deductible was part of the protection. Was told I have a 1 year warranty on replacement phone. titre: Worst warranty experience I've ever had
comment: I bought a pair of headphones about a year ago with this 3 year protection plan and they got damaged about 2 months after I bought them. I sent them in for repair and they fixed the cable and sent them back to me. Something they did in the repair process, or something else that happened to the headphones when they got damaged, changed the sound signature of the headphones significantly making them really bloated in the bass. I even bought the exact same pair from Amazon to compare the brand new ones to the ones that keep getting "repaired" and the sound signature issues are immediately obvious. The repeatedly sent me the headphones back saying there's nothing wrong with them and that I should just EQ the extra bass out. Completely unacceptable for a warranty you pair for that is supposed to remedy this exact problem of the headphones being damaged.I had to send in the headphones not once, not twice, but 3 times already and they wanted me to send them in for a 4th time to "make sure they're beyond repair". I've said over and over again, the driver in the headphones was damaged and that can't be fixed by changing the cable out. I need reimbursement from the warranty so I can buy a new pair of headphones and I keep getting the runaround.
Replacement shipped quickly.  Needed phone tech support. They were very helpful and resolved the problem quickly.

When I got there, the associate just took my old SIM card out of my old phone and put it in my new phone, while taking out the new SIM card, so i never had a use for it. I thought it was very unnecessary to have to go into a store for a simple task I could have done at home and there was no point in sending a new SIM card. WORST COMPANY EVERI can't believe Verizon would ever support this company and recommend it as an insurance option. I fell and my iPhone 8 bent so bad that the glass shattered on both sides. Was extremely relieved that I had insurance, filed the claim and got a REPLACEMENT within 24 hours. Had no issues with delievery, setup, was willing to pay the price at that point. However, I emphasize REPLACEMENT because all Asurion does is send out CHEAPLY refurbished pieces of junk. Within in days, I had discolorations on my screen, which are a hardware issue that Apple won't touch because the parts used aren't Apple, shortest battery life of all the iPhones I have ever had, and apps that wouldn't load for anything. Call Asurion several times and all they do is read off a script, they never stray from it, saying that the issue is because of the iPhone settings and that they just need to be reset. Even asks if it has been exposed to liquid, because apparently the new waterproof isn't waterproof. Meanwhile, Verizon stands by their claim, "It is not our problem." Shorted several hundred dollars and now I have to buy a new iPhone.

I have never once in my life written a bad review, but this company warrants it. They had to send me 3 new devices to get one that worked, and then it only worked for a couple months. The different issues included the phone would not turn on, battery died quick, it would not work often due to not being able to read the SIM card even though I paid to replace it, and lastly nothing worked out of wifi as if I had an ipod touch. I had to call 6 times this last time in order to get them to send me a new phone and tried all troubleshooting with the same issues after. They then accused me of lying saying I did not try the last trouble shooting even though I provided them with the date and time I did it exactly because the lady who did it did not make a note on my record. Also, for this I had to have another phone to call to do the troubleshooting, which was difficult for me. I have not even received this new replacement device because I could not be home due to work when they tried to deliver it and the company puts a limitation on it so I can not go pick it up the first day. Also, when I called to see if they could remove this because I was trying to leave town and needed GPS when not in wifi, the lady was super sarcastic, rude, and condescending. Worst company I have ever dealt with for product and customer service, and I usually give people the benefit of the doubt.

titre: Just great people and 5 stars service

comment: Received my replacement phone promptly through the mail. Customer service representative hung up on me when tried to call and set up new device.
Excellent customer service.

I pride myself on sharing positive customer service experiences with any company. This is by far the most negative and foul experience I’ve ever had with a brand, especially with one of their supervisors. I am extremely disappointed that Verizon “America’s most reliable network” is even associated with this company. I have used asurion in the past and never had any problems. I dropped and cracked my phone on March 12, 2019. I called the company to file a claim, the agent set up the process and I was to keep an eye out for an email within 3 hours to print, sign and submit paperwork via fax (optional). I had the rep repeat back my email to me to clarify he had it down correctly. I am traveling, so I assumed me  NOT receiving an email had something to do with that. I’m in Boston, shouldn’t be an issue anyway. I call the company back 24 hours later to check the status of my email, he suggested I check my spam folder, nothing. He finally send 2 of the same email to me immediately following our phone conversation. I use the hotels print/fax services to complete the process. I called again, to clarify the rep received my paperwork. They confirmed and I was to wait another 24 hours to receive another email to give them my financial information to complete the process. I proceed to finish the process and my credit card I initially declined as it kicks it back as a fraud alert, no problem. I confirm with my credit card company that the charge is valid and good to go. When I enter in my information again the company sends an immediate message that I am to call them to complete the payment process. I call AGAIN (this is the 4th phone call to the company) to finish the payment process. The rep tells me I am to wait ANOTHER 24 hours to receive an email to figure out why they won’t accept my payment. At this point I am completely frustrated and overwhelmed. Roughly 32 hours pass by and I have received no email or phone call. I call the a 5th time to figure out just what is going on. The first rep explains he can’t give me details on what’s happening but he can process my payment and I’ll receive my phone Monday the 18th. I explained I will be back home in California, so I will not be having them send phone to my hotel anymore. He explains it will take another 24 hours to process the change. I had him transfer me to a supervisor. The situation gets even better as I can barely understand him/her and requested detailed information about the company policy and procedures. They repeated back to me what I was initially told by the very first rep when I first started my claim. I completely understand and respect these.... but if I have been having these series of unfortunate events by the company whom are clearly NOT abiding by the policy, then what is the point of the policy?!?! Asurion is based in America so why the continuous delay in receiving my phone? He/she explained they don’t have time to call every 24 hours so that’s why they email... okay... cool but you never email me so what in the actual HECK? I have been in the customer service industry for almost 15 years, I love delivering outstanding customer service to all patrons. I am a people person and love interactions with all personalities and love the rewarding feeling of turning a bad situation into a fantastic one. I was hoping this company would understand my unfortunate situation and take care of me. I’m appalled this person is even considered a superior with the company! They had no intention of making the situation right and almost had no care for my disappointment. This is my far the most disgusting and careless company I’ve ever been associated with. I was later told I would be transferred to a superior of theirs, and this person left me on hold with a Spanish speaking recording for over 45 minutes. Wow! The disrespect is real within this company. This is completely outrageous.
The service was QUICK and Hassel FREE. Everything was just as advertised! Absolutely satisfied...NO complaints on my end!!

titre: 2+ weeks to file iPhone insurance claim
comment: I have been trying to file an insurance claim for a phone for 2 weeks now. Every time I get a step further, they tell me that additional information needs to be reviewed and they will get back to me in 24 hours. I submitted an affidavit today that I was assured, by both Verizon and Asurion, will be reviewed within 3 hours. When I called after 3.5 hours, I was told it was 3 business hours. I have screenshots of messages from Asurion and nobody specified 3 business hours. Verizon told me that I could have a new phone tomorrow as long as I completed documents by a certain time tonight. I called Asurion and someone said they were going to transfer me to the resolutions department, but the call disconnected. After I get this phone replaced, I am cancelling my insurance through Verizon and going with an independent insurance operator because this is straight nonsense. z.e.r.o. s.t.a.r.s.

titre: SUGGESTION FOR INITIAL CALL ON LOST CELL PHONES
comment: The representatives were all very courteous and patient with me. However, I believe the process could have gone smoother if on the very first contact I made to report the lost phone I had been advised to immediately contact AT&T and put the service on suspend.  I was instructed to do this after I downloaded and submitted the completed claim, which was denied until the service was placed on suspend. Needless to say, I had to summit a new claim, which further extended the processing.  In closing, I strongly suggest advising the customer to put service on suspend. Thanks for allowing me to voice my concern.

titre: Ordering the replacement phone was easy…
comment: Ordering the replacement phone was easy because the website was easy to use, and the phone arrived right on time. The return process was also very easy, although I was delayed a little because of the instructions on returning the phone. The instructions said to be sure to remove any batteries, etc, which is impossible in the phone I was returning. I actually went to the Verizon store to ask how to remove the battery, and I was told that it was impossible and to send it back as it was. It would have been more helpful to have known that in the instructions. Otherwise the process is extremely easy. I put the phone into the envelope, and back it went! I received an email letting me know that the phone had been received. Thank you, Asurion.

I just was posting that the insurance industry is Legalized form of gambling which is designed to take hard working people's incomes with not having actually rendered or tendered a service until you make a claim. Meanwhile we pay a premium for a product that could possibly NEVER have to be used. That being said, had that same amount of money to be taken from you been put into any type of interest bearing account you would be able to tender any  claims to be made two or MORE times over.   Now when you have bad luck, clumsy, or just plain accidents and make three claims within a year's time this company of which you have already paid twice the value of the NEW product, which is now well used, and ONLY worth half of the original price for which they bill you, will cancel your coverage. Quite frankly, because they've now gone from a profit to break even. Although, for two years they have made nothing but profits from you because unless you make a claim, this company will only have to pay for a data entry clerk and postage to send you a statement.   Now assuming that you NEVER make any claims the profit margin for this service per client is GROSSLY inflated!!

I have a phone with AT&T. My phone was stolen, i have insurance. The hole claim process was easy but didn't live up to it prommises. I gave a number where they could contact me incase there was an issue with my phone claim. They did not do this they instead contact an email that i never was told that they would contact me this way. I had to call AT&T to resolve this issue. The only problem with that is they wanted to send me to Asurion. Then Asurion would send me back to AT&T. Finally i got into contact with the right people, but they wanted for me to refile the claim since it got denied. They informed me the information i sent them did not exist any more. But some how the supervisor read me back all the information that was given to them on the form. After all this its going to take me 4 days to finally get my phone back. They really need to rethink there automated call system, i shouldn't be sent back and forth through at&t and Asurion. My information that was sent originally should be accessible, especially after a couple days. I am not sure who is writing these reviews about this company on this site. But trust me the only reason i recontacted them was because the reviews i read all said that this company was a 3 star at best. A lot of them had poor experience with the online issues and never received there phone and where never contacted. Asurion and AT&T please correct this.

I virtually never purchase non-required insurance on any product.  The insurance on my cell phone had been acquired by my employer to protect its investment in case of loss, theft or breakage.  When I retired, the phone came with me and so I benefited from the eventual replacement of my phone when it ceased to work.  I do not know the cost of the insurance, but I can attest that the phone's replacement was inexpensive (basically, only shipping & handling costs) and extremely quick (under 1 hour).  Excellent!

I was wondering if it was worth paying insurance on a three year old phone, it was; the I phone 6 plus was such a lemon. Off the bat the screen freeze was an issue but never gave it much thought I thought it was the software freezing up. Then the charging became an issue, the plug keep falling off and with the excessive battery drain it become a pain in the ... thats when I finally decided to make the claim; dreading the AT&T sales pitch to upgrade. I bit the bullet and called. Like always I had navigate a couple of numbers until I got to Asurion; that is when the happy story began. My claim was handled lighting fast; got my new phone the next. It said refurbushid but it looked brand spanking new. I waited two days to make the transfer just because I had to work and was still able to twist the old phone into working. I went the self tranfer route. It all went smoothly meaning the information upload into the new phone from the cloud and the erasing of the old data until the activation. Even after I found the activation path on the web site per the instructions I was not able to activated it myself, bummer. I was directed by the site to visit the nearest AT&T store. Lucky for me I’m in a very rural area and there are two stores to chose from within 15 minute drive at any time and in california so the weather is not an issue. The very helpful attendant at the store swap the chips and I was on my way. I took my wife to look at the phone selection for her next bithday that was very helpful, I least I was able to multi-task and not dread that I had hit an avoidable dead end.  I would have being able to swap out the SIM card with some good instruction, but in the long run I see why that end step is better left to someone that does it all the time, it avoids damage to a phone by those with little patience.Anyway thank you; that is why you got a great rating for this experience. The old phone is packed amd ready to drop off at the nearest USPS office

titre: My S8 screen cracked so I called…
comment: My S8 screen cracked so I called Asurion as Verizon directed me to do.The CS rep asked me to speak quietly.I told her I'm not going to whisper. Later in conversation, there was giggling on her end.She told me they don't have any repair specialists in my area...Phoenix (small town..ya know), and therefore rather than pay my $30.00 deductible and have glass the repaired, my only option would be to buy a replacement phone for $200.00. I told her absolutely not ! Its not my problem they don't have anyone nearby in a city of several million people. She then said I needed to lower my voice or she would hang up. I called verizon. Hmmmm...it seems we most certainly DO have repair shops and there is one in my neighborhood to boot !! Thanks to the Verizon sales rep, I will be getting my phone fixed for $30.00. This girl needs to be terminated from her job. I certainly would not want her representing my company.

titre: WOW !! This is the best experience w repair!
comment: I cracked the screen on my iPhone. I actually went to Apple first, they told me $130. That was insane to me!!  I didn’t have the phone for a month by then! I was sure I had some kind of protection from Apple!? NOPE!I forgot I had insurance through my provider.I have no local repair facility but was leaving town and there was one local to where I was going.I filed my claim and 2 days later took my phone in.The guy was knowledgeable, professional and very courteous! He was wonderful! I figured a couple hours, so we went for lunch. We didn’t even get through appetizers and got a text my phone was finished. Didn’t even take 30Minutes.I am beyond happy w this service and repair! I’ll def be keeping insurance on my phone, I’d rather deal with Asurion than Apple!Thanks so much for everything!

titre: No Assurity from Asurion- Faulty Fones
comment: Over the years I have had to make a claim for a lost or damaged iPhone. Ashrion send reconditioned phones promptly within 24 hrs. The problem both of the reconditioned phones failed to work properly. If a second phone is required then they decided to hat they should have 72 hrs to send phone #2 which replaces the phone they failed to recondition properly. And it must be mailed to the billing address. So in my case I had a vacation planned a day after I received the faulty phone. So I just had a trade-in to buy a new phone while traveling. Not an acceptable form of insuring I have an operational phone after several years of premiums.

Can't/won't help me. I sent my phone in to be repaired by Asurion and they found additional damage to my phone that wasn't there when I sent it in. I filed a claim with FedEx but they won't talk to me because they say Asurion is the shipper and is the one who'd they need to talk to you. Asurion tells me no such thing exists and tells me to talk to FedEx. In waiting and wanting to talk to supervisors to help me I have been transferred to FedEx numerous times and also Verizon instead of speaking with a manager at Asurion. Sounds like a crooked scheme. Asurion does not support their customers. I would rate zero if I could.

I broke my phone and when I got a loaner phone from sprint they cancelled my complete care while I was in the middle of a claim for my iPhone 10. I received a text saying my complete care was changed on my account and if this was not me to contact this number: 877-699-5798. I then spoke a rep who then transferred me to another rep who said she had added the insurance back onto the plan and it would take 24-48 hours to process the request. I then proceeded to make an appointment online with apple and drove an hour to said appointment. Wherein I was informed that the insurance has not been added back onto my sprint account almost a week before I traveled all that way to get a new phone. So I was then told that the insurance was at that time added back for sure and I'd have to wait another 48 hours and than travel back to the store to pick up a new apple phone for the price of my deductible. I asked the manager why this wasn't done when I called the first time almost a week prior ( to give them plenty of time to change it back even though it was never supposed to be taken off in the first place.) She had no explanation for the severe inconvenience they had caused me. I pay 20 extra dollars a month to have insurance on my phone each month,  just to get jerked around by this company that I'm paying on my sprint bill.
Good job thanks for everything got a new phone exactly the same as the old one

comment: Everything you promised you delivered.  Service at AT&T store was way less than good.  Manager told me to bring the phone you sent in and they would set it up for me. I did complete my transfer with a phone technician on my own.  If I can avoid the store in the future I will...as they are just not concerned with service.I am glad you have the phone I returned and that we are done with this process.

Several days later after being unable to charge my phone, I receive a message from dpd saying they were unable to deliver my parcel because no one was home (very odd given I was working from home that day). So I checked their website and hey presto, they had some how sent my charger to completely the wrong address. So still no charger. titre: My daughter’s phone is stolen in the…
comment: My daughter’s phone is stolen in the morning of 1/18/19 – probably around 9:45. Her backpack is slashed on the subway and someone has taken the phone.I call Verizon to report the phone as stolen the same day, 1/18. Verizon transfers my call to Asurion – where the agent there processes my claim and says that they’ll get a phone out to me right away. I get an email (1/18) indicating, “Your Asurion claim is complete”, and that a shipment is imminent. I then get a UPS tracking number confirming shipment.I later check the shipment status at UPS (probably 1/20), which indicates “Returning to Sender”. I first web chat with someone as Asurion to find out why the phone has been recalled by the sender. The Asurion web chat indicates something about “abuse of the program”. When asked to clarify, he indicated I needed to call in and talk to someone. I called, and reached the adjustor. She indicated that my claim had been denied. I asked why the claim and been denied, and she told me, “I can’t tell you why, read your Terms and Conditions.” Finding it hard to believe an adjustor could not tell me (the insured) why my claim had been denied, she assured me that, not only could she not tell me why my claim had been denied, she explained that she was prevented from doing so by law. When I asked her to cite that law, she declined, and again told me to read the Asurion Terms and Conditions.I called Verizon the next morning, 1/21. The Verizon agent calls Asurion, and tells me that Asurion has denied the claim because the phone service had been suspended. The Verizon agent says if we just re-institute the service and I re-file the claim, there should be no problem. The Verizon agent re-institutes service for the number, and transfers me to Asurion. The Asurion agent takes some information, and indicates that all I need do is fill out an Affidavit & Proof of Loss Statement, and upload that, along with a copy of my identification, all would be good. I printed out the Affidavit, filled it out and uploaded it and a copy of my drivers license to the Asurion site (1/22).On 1/23, I started with Asurion, and spoke to William – who could not offer much in the way of help, so I called Verizon. Verizon indicated at first that the Asurion notes indicated that I’d already received the replacement phone. I assured her that I had not. Verizon called Asurion, and we again spoke to William. William indicated that his notes said that I had cancelled my claim (odd, he made no mention of that the first time we spoke that day). I informed William I had done no such thing. William then transferred me to another operator, who then contacts the adjustor, who again indicates that I’ve been using the claim in some inappropriate way – in what way, she can’t say – but she says they’ll send out a letter explaining why. That was weeks ago – no letter.I post a review on another site – Asurion responds – “Rest Assured”, they say – this is not your standard customer service here at Asurion, and we’ll get to the bottom of this . . . .   After providing some requested information, including the best way to contact me – then nothing.  I’ve never heard from them again.Imagine if your health insurance company denied you an operation – and when asked why they’re denying your claim, they tell you, “I can’t tell you.” That’s the insurance you’re buying with Asurion.P.S. I've read the Terms and Conditions. I cannot for the life of me tell why Asurion has denied my claim. I am a good man, and try to live my life so that I can die proudly, without regret. I haven't tried to scam or trick or take advantage of anyone or anything. Asurion has accused me of exactly that - but they won't tell me why.  I can honestly say, this is unequivocally the worst customer service I've experienced anywhere - ever.

titre: Fix it or give Verizon another provider
comment: You need to figure out the operational issue of your customers being without a phone while their screen is replaced. I don't care if you loan me a very simple phone while it's being fixed that only has the ability to text and call, but I at least need those capabilities uninterrupted while going through the process of a claim. It is ridiculous that I pay for the service through Verizon, but NEVER go through them, my 'trusted' service provider, to deal with the issue of the protection plan that they advertise and push me to sign up for. That's some serious cognitive dissonance. The rep at Verizon literally have me a post-it note with your website written out in highlighter. Seriously?! You don't even have a printout, pre-formatted email, card, etc. to give customers that need to file a claim? Don't you expect them to go to the Verizon store to get help with their not-iPhone? God help you all, especially your marketing and service departments.

titre: Asurion screen repair went bad in a month & they wouldn't fix it
comment: Asurion replaced my screen for over $100 deductible.  It worked for about 10 days and then the touch started dragging.  Then my touch ID stopped working.  Within the month, the screen started bleeding on the edges.  I contacted them to get it fixed and they told me I had to file a new claim and pay another $100.  When I pressed the issue, they tried to say it was a device failure, not a screen failure.  I pointed out that a faulty screen repair would absolutely cause these problems.. there is evidence of the issue being related all over the place online.  They refused to honor their bad repair.These insurance plans are not worth it.  You can get a screen replacement for less than the deductible they charge.  And they send you bad refurb phones if you lose yours.  You will never win with these insurance plans.. that's why they offer them.Many people don't realize YOUR PHONE IS COVERED FOR LOSS OR THEFT BY YOUR HOMEOWNERS OR RENTERS INSURANCE!  You don't need the fake insurance AT&T sells.

titre: No Point in Even Having the Insurance
comment: What is the purpose of having insurance if it doesn't actually cover anything? I only needed a screen replacement but the service won't let me do so. Instead it wants me to replace the entire phone. Something that would normally cost $30 according to them would instead cost me $200! That is completely ridiculous. Complete waste of my time and money.Edit in response to Asurion: A tactic I've noticed they've used to all the sincere 1 star reviews is offer to talk to someone about their policies. Why should I, or anyone else, speak to yet another representative telling me I need to pay $200 to fix a screen. Nah, Asurion. If you don't want to people to be mad, you should tell people from the very start if a phone will be covered instead of dragging them through the process before springing a multi hundred dollar bill on them.

titre: I dropped my iPhone accidentally onto a…
comment: I dropped my iPhone accidentally onto a concrete surface. The screen cracked pretty badly and from then on didn't respond to my touch. The phone would power up, but I could see only half of the screen. My iPhone had been dropped accidentally many times before, and survived the drop, but this time, the drop rendered it totally dysfunctional. Luckily, I had purchased Asurion Insurance when I first bought my phone to cover such mishaps. All I had to do was report my accident and damage to Asurion online. Within a couple of days Asurion mailed me a brand new iPhone at no charge and made it very easy for me to return my damaged one by a prepaid mailing label.

The customer service was good. I wish there was some claim options over the weekend. The deductible is high in my opinion. In two years, you’ve paid about $240 for the policy, then you have a $200 deductible. So once you owe $200 or less on your phone, you should probably cancel it. You also have no options through your cell phone provider so you are without a phone for at least two days, more if the damage happens on Friday night. However, if you have a new phone on a payment plan then you can get a refurbished replacement in 48 hours without much hassle, so that is a good security option for those of us who aren’t rich!

comment: My 80 year old mother bought a phone thru a phone store.  She was told this insurance was very important and would cover all her problems.  She was not told about what wasn’t covered, deductibles or refurbished replacements.  When her phone a a defect they first said it was covered then said it would cost her $89 because there was an unrelated crack in the glass.  They told her to use her old phone until she could come up with the money.  They said she needed to continue the insurance of $13 on the broken phone.  I found out that was wrong.  Our fault was not thoroughly checking this out.  Their fault was taking advantage of a senior who trusted them because she just wanted a phone.  Unbelievable at best.

titre: I bought an iPhone XS Max with bell by…
comment: I bought an iPhone XS Max with bell by paying $1500 upfront fee and yes with Asurion insurance plan. I got insurance because the phone itself is worth more than $2200. Unfortunately I lost it in a restaurant. Right away I called Asurion about it and they said that they'll send me an affidavit form and a link where I can upload my documents. So I did everything they said and I got an email saying that I'll receive a notification as soon as it's reviewed please give us 24 business hours. I believe that I waited far more than that but didn't got any answer. So I decided to call Asurion about this they said it's being reviewed and all that. so waited more after that nothing happened called Asurion again and they said the id you submitted is not valid which was a passport. So I again wrote the affidavit clearly and gave them my drivers license but this time waited like for a week and after a week of calling again and again they finally gave me an answer saying that you few years ago had a claim with Asurion and our verification team declines your request and you won't be able to get a replacement device because of that. That's it from our side you can contact bell for more we can't do anything more than this. Bell said talk to Asurion because they are the ones who handle replacement devices. In the end I had to pay off my phone because bell said you're under a contract for 2 years. I don't know what to do anymore. I was helpless. I will suggest not to go for Asurion and pay $16 just for getting a hard time later on getting your claim because I am sure you guys can face the same thing as well. I just wasted $2500 dealing with all this and ended up having a box and accessories of the iPhone. I paid it off because I had no choice left. I have a clean record in everything. Because If I didn't pay the left balance they will screw my credit history and it can go to collections. I don't even have time to go to a court my skipping my work as I got family to support and bills to pay I work 7 days a week. I always tried to get a solution from them but never got helped. Because they don't give a single s**t about this. The representative on the phone with bell and Asurion were enjoying my situation. They just didn't laugh. I am so ripped off. I hope I had a lot of money and time so that I could see these guys in court. :(

titre: will make sure this company never…
comment: brand new galaxy s9 (3 weeks old) dropped in the parking lot and before we realized it a vehicle ran over it. Got hold of Asurion and they said no proble we will send a new phone out right away.Got an email the next day saying out of stock but would send it out in a couple days. Got an email couple days saying phone was being shipped that day. turns out it was but by ground freight so we received it in 10 days. what we got was a phone loose in a much bigger box which allowed the phone to bounce around inside.Turns out it was a refurbished phone at a cost of 300 to replace our brand new one. told them we didn't want it and were going to send back they send that's fine but they are keeping the 300 dollars. after much spending lots of the time on the phone they promised me that this phone had gone through all the inspections and was basically a brand new phone and had 90 days warranty. gave into their lies and finally decided to just bite the bullet and activate it.turns out it doesn't hold a charge and gets quite warm when you plug it in the phone also turns on and off on its own. called to say its not working and need to fix or relace it but they are saying they decline the repair or replace because I cancelled my SPC.Told them it shouldn't matter because I have emails and voive calls telling me my phone has 90 days warranty and its only been 2 weeks. never dealt with such a sleezy company like this before but they will never see a penny of mine and if I'm ever in a store and someone else is asked if they want this insurance I will not hesitate to tell them the storyReason of review: Warranty issue.Monetary Loss: $1000.Preferred solution: Deliver product or service ordered.

don't get it at all,  filed a claim on my iPhone December 11th 2018 was told my phone would arrive within 2 days never came, I called and they said it went to wrong address and that it will be another 7-10 business days for me to receive it . So I waited 14 days due to holidays . Phone never came, I call again and they say the phone was never shipped out because it's on back order and that they will have an update on January 2nd so i call then and nothing to they connect me to corporate rep and they offered to issue a check instead and I would get it in 3-5 business days so I waited and gave a call yesterday the 10th of January and I'm told the check was mailed to wrong address like whats wrong with this picture, so I call today  just to confirm that they called bnk of America to put a stop payment on the check which I guess takes 3-5 be business days then another 7-10 business days to receive the check .. so I called where they say the check was mailed in NY mind you I'm in Florida and the check or anything in my name ever came so I called back to asurion and notified them and they said we know they have the check because we have tracking information lol Im like how ironic is that USPS standard mail doesnt have tracking information must be something new .. asurion runs like a car with no wheels going on 40 days with no phone but still a bill to pay .. and if you look at there reviews they have 2500 positive reviews all posted on 01/11/2019 I guess they're not just good a cooking the books but also cooking reviewsI recorded every call I made to them so hopefully I can send them to a higher office to show how they're such liers

titre: Used the Asurion website to file a claim for a cracked screen
comment: Used the Asurion website to file a claim for a repair of my cracked screen. Thought it was great that the Tech would come to my office to repair it.  The case I use covers the back of the phone except for the camera. When the Tech got here he found that there was damage the back of my Samsung Note 8.  Submitted the additional damage to Asurion and claim was denied.  When I called Asurion to find out what was going on I was told several different things from the folks I talked to. They wanted me to pay a $275 deductable and get a new phone. I don't want and don't need a new phone. When I finally got to Karen in the Customer Satisfaction/Office of the CEO area all she wanted to do was get me to file my claim online or let her do it and collect the $275 fee.  She took took the time to explain to me that screen repair is not a service that they should provide its a bonus to me the customer.  All I know is that I have paid for it. Everytime I asked a question to understand or tried to discuss something she referred me to the website where everything is clearly explained, the policies are clearly laid out and where the decuctables are clearly stated. At one point she accused me of wanting to have the fee waived, I had to remind her that I had never asked for that and did not want that.  I have a phone I like and just needed the screen repaired. Asurions focus on profit over Customer Satisfaction in this day and age is ridiculous.  Karen focus on getting my money and not delivering service that was paid for is disgusting. I can safely say that I won't be buying "insurance" from Asurion and will alert everyone that I can to avoid Asurion at all costs.  Because that is all they will do is cost you.

titre: Accidental Backup Deletion due to Flawed Claim Submission Process
comment: During my claim, the process to submit my claim required me to remove my old iPhone from Find My iPhone before the claim could get started.  Apple requires a two-part verification and since my damaged phone was unusable, I had to go through a lengthy process to actually get access to my account.  After a week of waiting, I assumed my claim was submitted, but was stalled at the last phase.  When finally accessing my account through Apple, I accidentally deleted my iPhone backup permanently deleting it.  When this happened, I did not see at the time any other options to clear that from my account and to get my claim actually started.When I received my replacement phone, I found out my fault in deleting my backup.  The Assurion tech offer whatever support he could, but was ultimately fruitless.In past claims, customers had to delete their iPhone from Find My iPhone after receiving the new and before returning their old device.  I understand the Asurion requirements, but had I had this option to submit my claim, I.e. not having to delete my account BEFORE a claim could be started, then I wouldn’t have lost over a years worth of personal and business data from my device.Aside from this, the process was relatively simple and satisfactory.

Decided to exchange my iPhone XS Max and within 2 weeks of having it dropped it- mistakenly. I had purchased a Zagg screen protector for the front which didn’t cause any damage, but it did crack the back of the phone. When I initially called Asurion a representative told me I would only have to pay $30.00 one time curtosy exchange fee since they don’t repair that in my area. A week later I’m getting a receipt from Asurion saying I owe another 170 because there was more damage to the phone then first told. I call again, and another representative tells me it looks like I’ve only been charged the 30 and they won’t be charging me anymore for this phone. Fast forward to today when my account was charged with the 170 and when I called this time, now it’s they can’t do anything and they don’t repair the back of the phone and whoever told me that was wrong. I also heard I must have been talking to someone from Verizon, as to insinuate, I’m an idot and called Verizon and not them. I literally pulled up the e mail and called the number on the e mail list.  I am upset I heard 3 different things within two weeks and what exactly am I paying insurance for anyways? Also, insulting my intelligence isn’t the way to keep anyone’s business. Just disappointed and wouldn’t recommended them to anyone right now.

DON'T insure with Asurion !!! It's a rip  ATT too!

titre: Made is so much easier and quicker
comment: Made is so much easier and quicker. Thanks.

I would give less stars if it was possible. The people working after normal business hours are very rude and will not listen to the customers. They read from the cue cards and have no clue what is actually going on. My initial claim to replace an iwatch was started 10 days ago. They could not do the claim within the computer system so it needed to be entered manually. I still have not recieved my watch so I called today for an update. The first person said the claim was started for an unlocked non ATT device. I requested to speak with someone else. The second person said there was no claim started. I asked to speak with someone else. The third person said I was being rude and he would not help me. He switched me to someone named Erica. I was on hold with her for over 10 minutes. She said she found the initial claim but I needed to verify the information that was submitted 10 days ago. Information given and verified. Again on hold 7 minutes. Erica came back to the line and stated that I needed to send an affidavit and a copy of my drivers license. When I questioned why this was needed after 20 years an ATT customer and using Asurian for 10 of those years she just reread the cue card stating that I needed to submit the documentation. I believe it is time to leave ATT and asurion until they get a customer service department that can do more than read a card and a script!!!

titre: Disappointed in their not doing as they said they would
comment: Contacted Asurion after having the all our family phones on the Verizon Plan covered for over a year (which means I paid into them $400 to $500 already). On Saturday when my phone screen broke called them. They said they could not get it fixed for more than a week locally so it would be the same to just send the phone in for repair by Fed-X. The call dropped 2-3 times due to the cell service but I stuck with it and called back until the claim was complete and I had double checked the address for the Fed-X mailer etc. They assured me the mailer would arrive on Monday so it would be fixed and returned end of the week give or take a day or two. I find out on Monday afternoon after waiting around for Fed-X and following all the instructions (backing up the phone, turning off find phone features etc.) that they didn't get the order to Fed-X to get me the mailer to return the phone until that morning (Monday) so now the return mailer won't get to me until Wed delaying my repair for another 3-4 days. They should not have had me run the hoops on my end if they were not going to get the pickup packaging to me until Wednesday. They called it a inconvenience when I called them. It is not the end of the world but just would have been better if they had not setup an expectation that they were not going to follow through on. The delay was not with Fed-X but rather their own operation. I now have a lack of confidence in their whole process. Will they take weeks and weeks to get my repaired phone back? Will they lose it? Ship it to the wrong address? etc.In hindsight I probably should have saved the money and self insured. I could have paid someone to fix the screen locally or even purchased a refurbished phone for the money and not have felt jerked around.

titre: iPhone X Repair:  2 WEEKS AND COUNTING
comment: 2 WEEKS AND COUNTING.  8+ HOURS OF PHONE CALLS AND COUNTING.I have an iPhone X on Verizon that has a crack on the screen.   Unfortunately the seamless easy process that is supposed to exist with Asurion's insurance service continues to elude me.Firstly, their "we'll send someone to you" policy for iPhone X phone repair apparently does not exist in either New York or Washington DC, so this claim is largely (or fully) fraudulent, as those are pretty major markets.  My local Verizon store had no idea that I would have to mail in my phone.  Next, Asurion repeatedly sent my envelope to the wrong address (St. instead of Pl.), even after the customer service reps say they changed the address in the system on failed delivery.  They claimed that their computer system was automatically changing it back!Once I managed to get my phone in the mail to them, a different customer service rep accidentally cancelled my repair while it was in the warehouse.  I was told to wait until my phone returned home (maybe it would be the correct address?) and start the process over again.  After demanding to speak with a supervisor (who was seemingly very helpful), we agreed to have it shipped to a different location than my home since I will be gone for the Christmas / New Years Holidays.  However, my claim number was changed without my knowledge so I couldn't check on the status.  So...I called again today (for hopefully the last time) to check the status of my claim.  They still haven't started working on it, and I was told that an alternative address from my home address is not a possibility.  So I likely will not have my phone for the holidays.  They could have agreed to expedite the process for me, override the system to send it to an address of my choice, or bite the bullet and send me an immediate replacement phone given all the human and/or systems error on their end, but they had no interest in any of these reasonable solutions.  Only the mechanical "I'm Sorry for the inconvenience".  BEWARE.

And the BEST part is, I filed a claim at noon and got my new phone by 11am the next morning!!! Amazing right?! Thanks you so much Asurion!

titre: No confidence in repair, replaced instead
comment: I cracked the glass on my S8+. OK, hey, no biggie. Asurion would send someone out and replace it for $49. WOW! That's great!Last click to make the appointment and WAIT A SECOND! They wanted me to accept the terms and one of those terms was (paraphrasing here) "even though we use quality aftermarket parts, we CANNOT guarantee your waterproof phone will be waterproof after the repair. We also can't guarantee everything will function as it did. WHAT? Apparently, Asurion is not very confident in the mobile repair crew and the cheap repair parts.I also could not cancel the repair appointment online. I needed to call. Even though I didn't click "accept" for that nonsense, they still had the appointment scheduled. So, since I didn't made a claim in a while, I had them replace the phone with a new one for $112. Very happy with the new phone.
They did well. Took a while, but well.

titre: Go with option B; make sure you have the phone-to-phone cable
comment: I first tried the option of sending my phone in for repair, I received the shipping packaging very quickly but it was never a convenient time to be without my phone for a week. So I tried again with the more expensive option of replacement.  The new phone arrived quickly, I called Asurion and spoke with an agent that helped me transfer the contents of the old phone to the new.  I could not find a cable cord to do this directly so the agent helped me do it by wifi. A few apps did not transfer, so I assume it was because of the wifi.  It would be nice if the phone-to-phone cable came with the new phone.  All in all, the agent was excellent and my new phone was up and running within 30 minutes, although it then took a while to download the apps that did not transfer and log into them all again.
Great getting replacement phone overnight thank you
Easy transaction! Great service.
Has to call twice but all ok

Easy and quick! I will continue to insure all my devices. My son had his tablet for one year. It suddenly stopped working. I made a 5 min phone call, paid a very minimal deductable (that they added to my next bill) and recieved his new tablet in two days. I did not wait on hold or endure a lengthy conversation. ALSO, I did not know that my deductable drops lower the longer I have my device. What a blessing!

The warranty protection I had on my phone proved to be worth its weight in gold.  My phone fell about 5’, the screen did not shatter, instead the phone landed on the bottom edge.  This caused the charging port to be misaligned, preventing the charging cord from plugging in, not a big issue because this phone has wireless charging.  The real problem was that the impact created a white line, about 3/16” to run vertically the entire length of the phone while held vertically, or horizontal while beiheld horizontally.I brought the phone to my local store, filed a claim, and the next day I had a replacement phone.  Very satisfied.

Asurion are liars! They sell false protection agreements and takes advantage of our military personnel and their families. They offer protection plans when it's already covered in the manufacturing company and their extended plan only covers for one year after the manufacturer. A two year plan only covers one year! And when you purchase it for a Christmas gift, the do not accept the date of gift..... So don't buy it on black Friday and expect to get help after that date..... Because it's expired!  The customer service reps are trained to be rude and they  don't appreciate the military protect them in the US.... Cause it's not a US company!!!! Boycot them!!!! Why is our military allowing this to be sold at the exchange? They are setting us up to pay for something they won't fix... Just take our money and nothing when it's needed and paid for.... The exchange and asurion should be sued!

The process to get a replacement was unacceptable. More so, this entire phone thing is a financial scam. These phones are not built to last the time contracts hold the consumer responsible. This company charges near $15 a month, PLUS $149.00 replacement. The cost to own a phone for a two year period comes to unacceptable numbers! Apple charges $99 a year plus $99 replacement, as does the Costco company. Saurian delivered a replacement that was dirty, had someones apps on it and the screen protection cover was not on the phone upon arrival. It was poorly packaged . What an unacceptable exchange for my hard earned dollars to this crummy phone that they thought acceptable. This is my last contract with them

titre: First time great second times the last
comment: First off I've used this company before to fix my phone and it only took 3 days and it was quick and efficient. This time however the customer service was nice but not helpful. I waited a week without shipping material and when I didn't receive any I got an email saying my package was on its way back to them with my phone. I NEVER EVEN GOT THE PACKAGE. So I then proceeded to online chat with Asurion because I don't have a working phone (reason I am using the insurance I've been paying for for 2 yrs). They told me it was a mistake email and that my shipping material would arrive monday (3 days bc it was friday) Come monday nothing, tuesday nothing. The new tracking number kept saying shipping label created expected delivery that monday. So when I chatted with the company again and they said I had to call because they couldn't help me even when I stated I didn't have a phone to call they proceeded to ask me to borrow someones phone. Even After another conversation they couldn't cancel my claim and they wanted me to call in a couple days. Then when I called again they said That I should call this coming monday to refile my claim and I should receive new shipping material that tuesday. So overall its going to take me about a month to get my phone fixed because they messed up and they didn't even offer me anything. Will not be using this company again its a shame.

titre: Asurion is a fraud so are the carriers as well "Verizon"
comment: Asurion is a fraud ! Just  another way to take your money along with cell phone providers, in my case "Verizon"! They promise alot of thing and you pay for the top insurance but when you need them to help you and uphold there integrity they are just trying to take your money. They lie and say that they have repair techs and locations to fix a cracked screen for $29. When it occurs they just so happen to not have the parts ,facilities, or techs. Let's keep in mind though they expect you to pay the monthly payments along with the carrier or late fees apply.  I had a crack a few months back the lady said I had to pay the full deduction $175-200 dollars for a replacement she said there were no other options. I just cracked my screen  a few months later and a guy from asurion came to my house and took 10 mins and fixed it for $29 next day. They dont hold any honesty they just want their commission and the phone carriers let them get away with it and dont help there customers. Best buy is the place to get insurance ,cheaper cost,honest people and same day service. Dont make the mistake to go with asurion then and the carriers dont care about anything expect more money. They can't even admit the mistake and give you money back or a credit they are full of excuses. Cant believe this company is used by every provider.  Horrible horrible horrible. Horrible  Verizon customer support as well Jimmy Lakey

Verizon Asurion - Not worth it when your phone won't start and you need a repair now.When your phone will not start and you need a repair now. Not worth it. They set me up with a repair company. It is 20 miles away. The only one they contract with. I called this company. uBreakiFix. They made every excuse and stated I would have to pay and get reimbursed. I left the phone on the car at the car wash. The phone was not submerged in water. The phone is water resistant. The phone is functional - Just no display. Have to pay on my own. $325.00 to have my phone fixed today. Not worth paying a monthly insurance premium. And yes, I called Asurion with my concern. LOL......... They would have paid the contracted company an amount to fix me phone. They don't care.I do not recommend this product.

titre: EASY TO FILE A CLAIM AND PROMPT RESPONCE

comment: The overall experience was satisfactory. I was happy with the one day turn around on the new phone but also felt rushed when I had a question.

I broke the front glass on my galaxy s8+ at work on Saturday 12/1. Filed a claim online that night and opted to go with the repair rather than a refurbished replacement phone since the damage was so minor. Scheduled an appointment for today 12/4 and the technician arrived right on time, was courteous and professional. To top it all off I received a new battery, frame and rear glass on the repair ($300+ worth of parts) even though it was a simple crack on the front of the phone, the tech literally just transferred the camera and motherboard into a brand new phone.Overall, well worth the $8 a month I pay through AT&T. Top notch company, excellent customer service, would highly recommend to anyone.

Very prompt service

Where to begin, for starters I have a galaxy s8+ with Verizon. I've had this phone for about 2 years, my screen finally cracked in the corner and I resourced to my insurance I pay 13 a month for to get the screen fixed. So, online I was able to schedule and pay the deducable of $29 and a technician will come to my home and repair my phone. I scheduled a day in October 2018 and took a day off of work to be there at the time 11-1. Well the day came and I waited till 3pm for the tech, he never showed. I thought okay things happen, so I contacted asurion and they couldnt contact the tech. They advised me to reschedule my repair so I did. The next appointment available was in November at the end of the month for the same time 11-1. Within the next month my phones screen was getting much worse glass was falling out of the screen with new cracks was sprouting from the corner. The day came for my phone to be repaired I waited again and no one showed another day off work to do this. I can say at this point I'm furious. So I contact asurion they again cannot explain why this tech didnt show, they wanted me to reschedule again. I told them no way something else needs to be done. I can take my phone somewhere to be repaired or something other than having someone not show again. Asurion got in touch with their service department, they told me there wasn't a tech in my area or even close to come to my home and make the repair and they didnt know why multiple Customer service agents was scheduling the repair multiple times. So their next solution was to send me out another phone. With the deductable I had already paid and they said they would wave the extra fee for the new phone they would send me which was $170. The $170+$29 is $199. Over the phone the customer service agent couldnt give me a confirmation or a tracking number for the new phone but advised me it would be here Tuesday, it was Thursday. I figured that's pretty quick considering the weekend. Tuesday came around no phone, I waited till Wednesday to call them back to find out the order wasnt completed because they didnt have a card on file, for just incase didnt return my old phone within 15 days. I gave them my card to put on file, I was reassured multiple times my card wouldnt be charged unless I didnt return the old phone. I asked this countless times. In my gut I knew it was going to be charged, but it was a chance I had to take i needed a new phone. So few days later I get the phone on a Saturday and I set it up. Checked my bank account they charged me $170 for this phone when I was assured the fee was waved. I called them back they told me we see the fee is waved and we dont know why the charge was taken out of your account. We dont see it was charged on our end. Well i had a reference number from my bank and she told me to give it a few days it may disappear but if it doesn't to call them back. Low and behold it didnt disappear. So, I called them back told them the issue everytime I call its added more to the problem for them if the could get it correct the first time. Now they tell me they will refund the money and it will take 3-5 business days to process and be refunded depending on my bank. It took 4 business days, but the refunded amount was only $29 not $170 like promised... it's a constant issue with this company... This was all within 30 seconds of being on the phone with me & as I hung up confused because I knew that information  couldn’t be right. I checked through my emails and realized he had made a mistake with the information he had on hand. I called back and a kind young lady (the second service rep) listened to my concern and confirmed my dates of when my claim initially started and when I actually receive my first device. She understood and was empathetic to my concern and problem and took ownership of the first person mistake & helped me and that’s in my opinion is what customer service is about. She checked the data base thoroughly and was confused herself as to why the first customer service rep said what he said to me but she did her due diligence and started my new claim and was able to order my device. Although my claim wasn’t done correctly the first time my second rep swooped in and saved the day my doing her job correctly incomparison to the first rep who I believe just wanted to get off the phone with me. I would rate her 5 stars any day.

titre: Galaxy S7 USB Port Fire Hazard
comment: My Samsung Galaxy S7 started making an electrical arching noise at the USB port.  I contacted Asurion and they assisted me with my claim via chat app.  However, to completely finish my claim I had to go to the Asurion website (one stop shop would have been nice).  I did notice that the replacement cost has increased (still cheaper than a new phone).  I received the new phone via FedEx the next day.  I called 1-866-853-2601 (connect with a device expert) to set it up my new phone but was transferred to Verizon…I could have just called Verizon, first.  Apparently, they had no Galaxy S7 phones available so they sent me a Galaxy S8…thank you.  Although I had claim filing and set up procedures issues, I highly recommend Asurion to all my friends and family.
Service was excellent. Received replacement phone  the next day and they even sent a return label for the damaged phone. A very pleasant experience

I would have given 5 stars because the actual process for reporting the damage to the phone and the assistance in obtaining and activating the new phone (and returning the damaged one) was excellent and the instructions were easy to understand, but contacting Asurion via phone was time-consuming and daunting!

An affidavit and government picture ID is drastic. I've been paying insurance for over a decade and that was never requested. With identity theft on a rise, of which I've been a victim, I definitely didn't appreciate that. I needed it, I pay for it, so I used it. But I'm skeptical for future reference.

I'm being told for the THIRD DAY that my claim is being reviewed and that it'll take 24 hours yet, 72 hours later, it still hasn't been completed. Your company is dragging it's feet in doing their job yet, I pay you monthly without pause. How is it that I pay for insurance and are told one thing yet, Asurion does what they want, when they want? Why is it my responsibility to continue inconveniently keep calling YOUR COMPANY back to make sure that someone is doing their job when it is apparent that they're not??? I'm SICK OF IT!!!!! I'm sure that when it is time for me to make payment for my deductible that you will not be as understanding if I take my time to make said paymoent. If I could give your company a '0' star rating, I would because this is a RIP off!

titre: It was a lot easier than I had…
comment: It was a lot easier than I had originally thought.  Though if I had went off my first contact with Asurion I would have gave 2 stars.  But it was AT&T who was at fault and not them.  So in the end they took care of me.

My phone completely died on me. I tried to file a claim on Asurion's website and was given a message to call customer service. After speaking to them and verifying all my info I was told that I would get an email within 24 hours to complete the claim. I never received an email but went back to the website and the option to complete the claim was there so I completed it. It said my replacement device would be shipped within 1-2 business days. After waiting 2 days I checked back on the website and it said my replacement device was shipped but there was no tracking information available. I was trying to be patient so I waited another day, still no phone (now 4 days since I began the claim). I initiated an online chat with customer service and was told that the delay was due to a "heavy demand for that device." I was told to continue checking the website for tracking and if it didn't arrive the next business day to call customer service. Of course it did not arrive so I called. I was told by this representative that the replacement device was on backorder!! She said it was showing her that it was ready to ship so I should keep checking the website for tracking throughout the day and should receive my phone the next day. After checking the website most of the day, by evening there was still no tracking. I called customer service again and was told that it has still not been shipped. She said it might ship the next day and just to wait for an email with tracking info.No one seems to want or be able to help me any more than to tell me it MAY ship and to wait for tracking information. After waiting 8 days, I then received an email saying my shipment would be delayed 7-10 business days! I could not wait another 1-2 weeks for a replacement phone and I could get no one to help me so I canceled the claim and the protection plan with AT&T (which was the easiest part of this whole thing) and went out and bought a new phone. I opted for the protection from the store I purchased it at.  I think making someone who has been paying premiums and a deductible for a replacement phone for years with very few claims go through this is completely unacceptable. I know I will never get anything back from Asurion but hope that this review will help to warn others of this bad rip off service.

Never, ever, under any circumstances, buy the insurance if it is offered with Asurion as the provider.  I have now been waiting for a week for my replacement device.  I cracked the screen on my iPhone.  Apple was willing to do the repair in an hour and a half for $300.  Of course, I elected to file the claim with my insurance.  HUGE MISTAKE!!  The first representative I spoke with assured me my device had shipped and would arrive on Friday.  I had provided my work address, so I sat in the office all day waiting on the new phone even after my boss told me to close up shop and go enjoy the unseasonably nice afternoon.  It never came.  Today when I called, the new representative I spoke to told me it STILL HASN’T EVEN SHIPPED.  I have now been a week with no phone, and they haven’t even shipped it!!  They are pure scam artists!!  Do yourself the biggest favor of your life and invest in Apple Care instead!

titre: I used to love them, now I am a lost customer
comment: For the high aggregated cost of thier service, Asurion really should give the customer better options.I will have my screen replaced at my own cost, and will NOT be continuing with Asurion's service. I regret recommending them to my family and friends and will be sure to rescind the recommendations.Overall, the technicians and agents working at Asurion were great. I never had a problem and in the past they have been competent and helpful. However, my last interaction with Assurion was very disappointing. A few months ago they replaced my phone screen, and over the next few months the replacement screen progressively went bad (according to online tech sources this is a known issue with the screens). Asurion refuses to replace the screen they installed, did not offer to follow up with a technician on my claim, and instead was only willing to send me a replacement phone. My current phone is old enough that I am certain to get a refurbished phone. Why would I want a refurbished phone when my current phone is perfectly fine except for the screen issue on the screen provided by Asurion? I asked to speak to a manager. He gave no help, no technical or cost justification, and stubbornly kept referring back to their process. Even though they provided the screen, AND my solution of screen replacement, still paying the deductible, was theoretically the cheaper of the two options for Assurion, no help! The manager was completely inflexible, unhelpful, and ambivalent.I gave Asurion two stars, instead of one, since they did offer a replacement phone. If I was completely desperate I could have gone that route.A screen replacement from the manufacturer or box store would have cost about the same as my Asurion payments. I should have simply saved the money and gone to a store for same day replacement. The manufacturer or store would have been more likely to stand by the replacement screen.

Super easy to work with. Though I requested the signature be waived because I could not be home during the time of delivery. I was assured that it would be waived and not be a problem. But, the signature was required, I was not home and ended up having to drive 30min to and from the UPS shipping center to retrieve my phone. I was also frustrated because I called, and the voice prompt said to place a claim online - online it said that they were out of my phone and it was backordered. I waited a day and heard nothing and decided to call someone to ask when I could expect the phone to not be backordered. The person on the phone then informed me my phone was not backordered and they could next day it.
