I am writing because I'm very unhappy and dissatisfied with the service provided by Asurion. I've had issues in the past with Asurion and receiving defected replacement phones. It took four replacement phones and then my suggestion of upgrading my phone to the next generation before my issue was resolved. I now have another issue with Asurion that I truly don't think is fair to your customers.  I purchased the Note 8 when it first came out because of its multitasking capabilities and that it was rated IP68. My original phone I received when I first bought the Note 8 worked wonderfully. I was able to use my phone in and/or near my pool. Unfortunately, I cracked the screen and had to pay 199 for a replacement; however, the Note 8 replacement device I received is not water resisted at all. The other day while using the phone in less than 3 feet of water, the phone got wet and powered off. It now won’t power up or charge. Even though there is no other physical damage and is still under their one year warranty, Asurion assists that I pay another 199 to replace a phone that is touted as water resistance up to submersion of 1.5 meters of fresh water for up to 30 minutes. It seems the replacement device was opened and repaired by Asurion and wasn't properly sealed. My Note 8 device now has no IP rating at all! Not sure how that is fair to the consumer who purchases this device because of the IP rating and capabilities. Asurion has no integrity, no ethical boundaries, and downright appalling. Asurion has to be the worse phone insurance company on the planet to think that the consumer should have to pay for another replacement for a device that wasn't sealed properly by them in the first place! I am a very unhappy, dissatisfied, and angry customer!

My phone broke on a Friday afternoon, was told by att that if I  placed my claim before 5:30pm I’ll have the exact same phone delivered to me on Saturday. So that’s what I did. So I  went online and filed a claimed, I needed to sign an affidavit and send it over with the claim.  They said they received my documents and I will not be getting my rose gold phone but a black one instead. I received an email after I filed the claim and said i would hear back within 24 hours. The weekend came and went and never heard anything from asurion, until today Monday. They needed more information from me. So I called them and they told me the affidavit needed to be signed by the primary phone holder who is my mother. My mother had major operation on legs 9/25 and has been in and out of the hospital since. She’s been currently in th hospital since October 10th due to many complications after her surgery. She’s in the ICU where no children are allowed and being a single mother myself it hasn’t been easy going to visit her. But asurion has no compassion and wasn’t willing to work with me even though my mother has me on the account to makes changes they still wouldn’t accept my signature. So I’m left now without a phone for probably another few days while I have 2 young children at home and a sick mother in the hospital. If and when my mother gets out of the hospital I’ll make sure she switches.
Thanks for the new phone and allowing me to keep my old phone.

What a rip off!!I cracked the screen on my almost new Iphone and contacted Asurion to replace the screen. They sent a technician to my home to repair it. In the process he broke the home button and apologized profusely stating this was the first time he had worked in an Iphone. Asurion sent me a phone which was obviously used and the battery lasted about 24 hours. I sent it back. They sent another phone and the battery died after 2 weeks. I sent it back. I have asked to speak to a supervisor and was told that it is not their policy to replace any phones with new phones and I could not speak with a supervisor. They assured me when they sent the second one that it would be a "good" one.I spoke with Asurion today was told they would "save me a new red phone" but I needed to call back when I had access to my ICloud account. When I called them back I was told by another person that they no longer make red phones. She said all phones were on back order and it would 3-7 days before I would get another phone.My original almost new phone was in perfect working condition and now I am receiving repeated defective phones because of an error by their technician.What a rip off!!!

titre: Eight direct phone calls 6 transfers of bad customer service...
comment: Eight direct phone calls, six transfers and one hour 15 minutes later... I  finally was able, thanks to Amanda, to CANCELL my cellphone insurance that I NO longer wanted.  Telishia of Sprint gave me the number for Asurion in which I initially spoke with (Jacob? Heavy accent) of Asurion... After numerous transfers and calls between Asurion and Sprint, I also spoke with a Hannah of Asurion in which i requested a supervisor. I had a rather testy conversation with an Irene,  who was alleged to be a supervisor for Asurion. Irene angrily stated that Asurion had NOTHING to do with the process of cancelling any insurances. I calmly asked, why would the Sprint representative tell me that, and then give me the name and contact number of Asurion?  After a couple more TRANSFERS, Donna,(Sprint) Amanda(Asurion??), Amanda assured me that my insurance WILL be cancelled within 2 business days.  But I was appalled to learn that Amanda confirmed that she actually works for Asurion... And that THEY ARE THE ENTITY that's charged with the responsibility of cancelling insurances...WOW REALLY?!!   What???... Did someone just NOT want me to cancel my insurance or just subject me to a bunch of wasted time and energy?!  I asked for a reference number, Amanad told me, I would receive an email confirming our conversation and the cancelling of the insurance.  An hour later i still have not received that email... Will be interesting to see how my 2 year old phone behaves after this review. This was a very rotten experience to say the least!!  Be forewarned... I will update this thread going forward.Not a happy camper

titre: My screen got cracked on my phone when…
comment: My screen got cracked on my phone when it accidentally slipped off the windshield mount as I was driving using the GPS and Google Maps. My phone was only about 6 months old, darn it! But a phone call to Verizon and they pointed me to Asurion for the replacement. With a single phone call to Asurion they approved my claim and sent out a phone immediately. I had my replacement phone the very next day! That was awesome service. But I had problems with the replacement phone, which was not my original phone, but supposedly an upgrade from it. Ok. I went through the permissions and saw that Google wanted to be able to activate my microphone at it's discretion...(What?!) No, denied. That is a ridiculous intrusion into my privacy. But then the next day I began using my phone while driving with the GPS and Google Maps App...and the phone would make pop ups come onto the screen and make a annoying notification noise which told me that Google Maps was having problems and would not work right unless I corrected the permissions. I would not. And it would do pop ups and the noise literally every 60 seconds while I was trying to use the Google Maps GPS. I am new to this area and must use GPS for my work or else I can not get around. I have to use it. My old phone would not do this and this was totally unacceptable to me as a replacement phone. I called Asurion back and explained the problem and they tried to help me to turn those notifications off, but continued use did confirm that the notifications were still happening, Totally unacceptable as a replacement phone! I asked for my original model phone back, I did not want a so called upgrade which was no upgrade to me! It was potentially dangerous for me and could have caused me to get into an auto accident by blocking my Google Maps screen with the popups and me trying to drive and see the screen. Asurion told me that they did not have any phones of the same model that I had before...OkI called Verizon and explained the problem with the replacement phone. They too, also tried to help me shut off the pop ups and notifications, again unsuccessfully. So I told Verizon that this was an unacceptable replacement phone for me and that they were going to have to provide another replacement phone which would not do these things. The said it is not possible. I asked for a phone of my original model and they told me that that model phone could not evn wotk on their system anymore. I did not believe that. That phone was only 6 months old. They essentially said "tough". Repeated calls to verizon were met with disdain and no customer service whatsoever. In frustration, I again called Asurion, and they tried again to help me turn off the pop ups, etc., to no avail. I said why couldn't I just get my old phone back again and only that. It worked good and did not have annoyances built in. The nice lady from Asurion said, oh we can do that. I said, huh? they said no before. Oh we were just out of stock, we have them now...So I got my original model phone back the next day again.I called verizon to activate it without saying anything, to see if they could or could not activate it, and they could and they did...Problem solved. Thank You Asurion. This is proof that Verizon lied to me. It has been working fine, the GPS and Maps is good. No problems. I was about to leave Verizon as a customer because they lied...But the way that Asurion treated me, has made me decide to stay. Not because of Verizon...because of Asurion and their professionalism and level of customer service. Verizon bad LIARS.Asurion GOOD...

titre: My Iphone 8 plus has a shattered…
comment: My Iphone 8 plus has a shattered screen. 7 days ago I filed a claim with the company Asurion. I paid $29 to have the phone fixed. The website stated on the claim file page that if they cannot fix the phone they will send out a replacement phone. Now, 7 days later, the website is completely different from when I filed the claim. When you have a shattered screen, an Iphone screen at that, obviously its going to come with touch screen issues. Fast forward to today. They are sending the shattered phone back. And asking me to pay $170 extra dollars to send out a replacement phone. I called and spoke with 4 people the first person I did not get a name. The second person was Cheryl, the third person was Jennifer with care solutions, and the fourth person was apparently from their "CEO OFFICE" Melissa with the ID number IDT162655. She did not deny the fact that the website stated this, and kept saying that there was a malfunction with the screen which is why they could not replace the phone/fix the phone. My issue with this, is that the website didn't say if anything was wrong with the LCD screen they would not be able to fix the phone and you would be required to buy a replacement. It asked if the screen was shattered, obviously I said yes. They said great, send it in and we'll fix it or replace it within 3 business days. I was told the same thing over and over again. I was not offered any sympathy for their misrepresentation and false advertising. I was "apologized" to but that apology was always followed by a "but". I have paid for insurance with this company for 7 years. I have filed 2 claims now. One a few  years ago, they sent me a refurbished phone (which okay, i get that) but the first one was so crappy that it would not work. They sent out a new one, but it was like pulling teeth to get them to replace the one they just sent. They sent the second one and it was almost as crappy but at least this one worked. I only had to have it for 3 months so I left it alone. I'm extremely upset with the lack of assistance that I received. I am extremely upset with the false advertising and misrepresentation, that they clearly knew was happening since they removed it from their site within 5 days. If you can help it, dont use this company. Just don't.

But, and get this, if I turned my phone in I would only get $32.  How does that work.  I'm never insuring a phone again.

titre: Don't purchase the Home Depot Asurion/Newcorp Protection Plan
comment: In my Home Depot Asurion/Newcorp Extended Protection Plan which I purchased at the same time I purchased the GE Dryer I filed 8 laundry claims over a 1 year period and I am still waiting to receive 5 of these claims. My GE Dryer was deemed unrepairable and I requested a check for reimbursement months ago and I still haven't received that either.I have had to send numerous copies of the original receipt to prove the amount that I paid for this GE Dryer but yet whenever I contact Asurion and I speak to a supervisor they ALWAYS state a different amount,they are the worse company to deal with in the world plusThey do not get anything right!It shouldn't take up to 1 year to receive Laundry Reimbursement Checks and the Total Reimbursement Check for the cost of the dryer.The Lemon Law regarding total Reimbursement Check Amount and Laundry Claims Reimbursements Checks are stated in the extended Protection Plan but yet Asurion makes The CUSTOMER WAIT SEVERAL MONTHS/YEARS WHILE THE FUMBLE AROUND with giving idiotic excuses as to their incompetence.

You didn't have a black phone like mine but you had a white one which was fine. Your help desk was a great help to me. My only complaint is that my order had to be reviewed which took 24 hours. I was on vacation in Orlando when my phone broke I called on a Friday night and couldn't get a phone until Tuesday. and when I did receive my phone I was very happy. There should be a way to keep the customer more up-to-date and to get the phones out faster on a weekend.

titre: Best service I have ever had

comment: ALWAYS A GREAT EXPERIENCE.
Fast essy replacement.
Efficient product in excellent condition.

This has been the worst experience with customer service ever. Just lies and more lies every day when I call just to get me off the phone. I pay alot of money for insurance on my sons phone and then pay a very high deductible when it gets damaged. But I cant get anyone to actually SEND me the replacement phone. I am on hold with them now for the 7th time in the last 7 days. On Sept 26 I filed my claim online and received an email that it had shipped and I would have it the next day. But the email did not include a tracking number of course and neither did their website status tracking. Every time I talk to them to say I still dont have the phone they lie and tell me that it is shipping that day and I will have it the next day. Well here it is the 3rd of October and I was told on Monday that it would be here today. No phone still! In the beginning I was told that my online claim was "cancelled by our system". So then she refiled my claim over the phone and then I had to have another claim filed over the phone the day after that because they couldnt find it. Then I called on Monday and was told that the phone has been ready to ship for a week but they were waiting on my payment to clear!! Really? I paid for the claim ONLINE with my debit card and the money was deducted immediately. So again, lies about why they are not shipping it. Now I cant get through to a CSR if I type in my phone number at the beginning. I am just immediately disconnected. I did this 4 times and was disconnected every time. So this time I called back and typed in a different number and was put right through to the call queue. What a bunch of crap!
Got me reconnected quickly and painlessly. I would recommend to anyone..
You guys did a awesome job on helping me get what I needed

titre: Quick delivery and very friendly staff!
Watch out they want a copy of your ID's…
comment: Watch out they want a copy of your ID's send to them, via email or fax. Lets get real and practical how secure is that ? To my understanding that is not legal. There are more ways to verify the person's identity. ( now this is just for a warranty claim and taking it little far )They denied my claim, which is fine, but, I know I'm safe.

titre: The service reps that I talked to were…
comment: The service reps that I talked to were awesome. They handled everything fast and were a great help from taking my claim to helping me set up my new phone.

titre: The Asurion insurance company lies and…
comment: The Asurion insurance company lies and does not communicate with customers.  I bought a refurbished Mac book for my daughter through Walmart and bought extended warranty with it. Asurion was carried.  The display screen cracked so I called but laptop was useable and functioning.  I was told to send in.  They recieved.  Got 1 notification that part was ordered. After 2-3 weeks heard nothing.  I had to initiate all communication was told part back ordered then it was received then testing then all of a sudden they  can’t fix it.  Going to replace.  Now 1 and 1/2 month later an E-card refund is sent to my email even though I was told day before by a supervisor that here’s the number to call his name was Kyle and they have exchange for me to chose from.  I would not every buy extended warranty from this company

titre: My phone had been malfunctioning for…
comment: My phone had been malfunctioning for several months and I wasn’t sure why. I finally called and talked to customer service at Asurion, with no problems, they had me a replacement phone to my home in two days.Hassle free.
fast, convenient and correct

titre: The service I received was worth 5…
comment: The service I received was worth 5 stars.  Fast and efficient. HOWEVER - it is obsurd that you cant fix an iPhone X cracked screen (your system said it wasn’t available in my area -Los Angeles, I also tried zip codes all over the USA and none worked.)  Forcing me to replace the entire device means the cost of the deductible was about the same price Apple would have charged me to replace the screen.  So why bother with costly insurance?????
Very knowledgeable customer service. I appreciate that when it comes to electronics.
The process, even the computerized phone system to start the call, was easy and quick.  The phone was at my house less than 24 hours later.  THANK YOU!

This is the 2nd time I have made an insurance claim on my phone. Each time I was sent a new phone, no questions asked. All I had to do was return my old phone after the new one was received. The 1st time I paid a $99 deductible and received an iPhone 5s in place of my iPhone 5, which I had dropped in water. The 2nd time, almost 3 years later, I paid a $75 deductible and received an iPhone 6 in place of my iPhone 5s, which had a cracked screen. The monthly insurance price of $8.99 is definitely worth it for the cost of an iPhone. I am very pleased with Asurion!

titre: Fast action for the phone replace.
comment: Fast action for the phone replace.. Elimination of stress
I'm a very satisfied customer. Submitting the online paperwork was easy, and the phone was delivered quickly, so we were back online in no time.

My appointment was scheduled for tomorrow afternoon. I recieved a call from the technician who was going to fix my phone and he asked could he change the hours because it was such a long distance from where he was going to be. I told him it was fine so we changed it too 5pm-7pm. It was originally from 3-5. I checked my emails and I had one from the company stating my appointment has been canceled! After the fact I have taken off work for this. I called the company to explain and the first person hung up on me after she put me on hold for 20min. So I called back and asked to speak with a manager. She was no better! I hope and pray this is the last time I have to deal with this company! Now if my phone gets any worse I will have to come out of pocket $199.00 because they cant keep their word. This is not right what so ever! When i broke my phone the first time they was quick to send me another one, but this time with a cracked screen (at any second it can completely break) which only cost me $40 I cant seem to get someone out here! I hope you all have better luck! I will NEVER use this company again!
Thanks for the excellent service. I had my replacement phone up and running in 3 days. Online claim site is very easy to use.

Somehow I got ahold of another phone # directly to Asurion and voila, the process was quick and easy and I got a replacement phone the next day. titre: Completely useless service if you are…
comment: Completely useless service if you are looking for a fast repair in your area.  According to the “customer service” rep, there is not a person or place within 50 miles of NYC, Philadelphia or Central NJ who can help with a cracked screen.  Option was to either have my phone mailed in to be repaired (4 days total) or full replacement for $199.  Who can be without their phones for that long and who would want to pay an additional $199 when you already pay for insurance monthly?  Kim, the customer service rep, repeated her company line and refused to think differently about how to solve my issue.  She coudnt even tell me where the nearest location was for me to drive my own phone to get replaced.  And when she said no one above her was at work right now, i asked her to have one of them call me back...her reply “the system wont allow me to do it.”  How about a pen and a piece of paper, Kim?  Terrible service.  I’m cancelling today.  Dont fall into this trap...asurion is a waste!!!!

titre: It has been over a week
comment: It has been over a week. So far 3 phones have been sent to replace my device. All 3 did not come with a battery and 1 had no sim card. Finally got a phone on the way (again) and because of the way the shipped it I will not receive it untill Tuesday (it's Friday). This has been blunder after blunder. Totally bad "service experience". If there were a minus option they would rate a minus 3 (1 for each failed attempt). Pathetic.
Amazing! Received great customer service. Received cell phone in great condition

In regards to my claim number 441564028, the way in which this claim has been handled is an embarrassment to your organization. No way should I have had to take this to the level of the Office of the CEO. It should also be noted at the end of my conversation with the representative in the Office of the CEO I was asked if I wanted to participate in a survey to which I answered yes and when transferred the line disconnected.  An accident; I don't think so!  This is another example of how the little guy consumer is taken advantage of and inconvenienced. Most would take it and not make any noise but I refuse to allow you to receive a pass for the shameful treatment that I received as a consumer and senior citizen.My original claim number was 441553991. I followed the procedure as advised on the Asurion website in conjunction with a technical support assistant on 9/27/2018 and waited for the 3 hour time period to pay the $199.00 deductable associated with the insurance policy. The email never came but instead received one that stated the claim was under review and someone would get back to me within 24 hours. This morning I check the claim online to find out the claim was denied because there was no insurance policy in force. The insurance coverage was verified yesterday by both a Verizon representative and an Asurion representative. This morning I learned the policy on my device has been in place since 2016 so I would like to know who made the error. What representative reviewed my case and made the decision to void my claim? I have have been a Verizon customer for many years and always insured my devices with Asurion. Apparently there is no other company that Verizon uses so if I want to continue with Verizon and have insured devices I have to use Asurion. Sounds like a monopoly to me and it would not surprise me to find out the largest shareholder in Asurion is Verizon. If enough consumers understood situations like this we could bring companies like this to their knees and this may result in my time with Verizon as a faithful customer coming to an end.

titre: The whole claim process was easy and we…
comment: The whole claim process was easy and we had the replacement in a couple of days.

VERY unhappy with Asurion’s Walmart product care plan customer service. I cannot remember the last time I posted something like this - I am beyond frustrated. I purchased a Daniel Wellington watch in Dec. 2016, and bought the 2 year service plan warranty. The watch broke, and I have filed a claim, then was told I would be emailed a shipping label (confirmed email address numerous times).I have been in contact with different customer service representatives via email AND phone EIGHT TIMES in the past 2 weeks in regards to the label to be sent to my email, all of whom stated the label was/will be sent to my email. I checked all folders, including junk/spam, found no label, and emailed them each time, to which they promised it would be sent. NOTHING has come yet. I called to complain about this issue 2 days ago, on Monday Sept. 24th, and the rep PROMISED me I would receive a call from them in 1-2 business days to ensure I received label. I have yet to receive any label to my email, and did not receive a call (lied to, once again).I have never had to deal with customer service representatives over one issue EVER, and not to mention, be told false statements regarding my label.I expect Asurion/Walmart to remedy this situation, and then some. Very frustrated.

titre: While I was leery of spending money…
comment: While I was leery of spending money every month for insurance on a product that I felt should be made well enough to not need insurance (is that even a thing anymore?), I did purchase it for my Samsung Galaxy S6 Active three years ago.  For the last 6 months, or so, the battery has been dying quicker and quicker...and finally gave up the ghost one weekend.  I placed a claim Sunday evening online...and by Wednesday had a replacement phone that was the same as, thought two versions newer, my prior phone...even to the point of being an Active.  There was no "proof" needed, though I did have 10 days to return my erased S6.  They provided information on how to activate the new phone, though there were a couple of different ways of doing so and I ended up on the phone with them that evening, but Asurion was professional and quick.  Thank you!

titre: The recliner ate my phone, Honest!

Well, to make a long story short  the Asurian Team didn't make me sit in the corner with a dunce cap or put me in a quiet zone for 30 minutes.  In fact, they were very understanding and only giggled a couple time( Thank You Asurian).  It ended up being a very positive experience.  They were very professional and within the first 5 minutes I felt at ease.  Thank You Asurion, and yes my New Phone Arrived within 24Hrs.

titre: Great time response to get my phone to…
comment: Great time response to get my phone to me

I have never written a review online; good, bad, or otherwise. However, the frustration I have experienced with Asurion has caused me to break my online silence.  The screen on my phone cracked. No problem, I thought, I have insurance. I made an appointment for a technician to come the next morning between 9-11. Between 9-11 I wait in my living room for the tech to show up. Nothing. No phone call, text, or email. At 1045 I contact the online live chat to make sure they were still coming or if I should reschedule. They assure me there is still an appointment and I should just give them a few minutes. So again I sit in my living room and wait. At 1130 I contact them again and they say oh sorry our technician said they tried to call me and drove to my house. IMPOSSIBLE! I had no calls or missed calls, no text or email. No one knocked on my door or rang my doorbell. Around 11 I did see a white unlabeled service looking truck pull in front of my neighbors house. I wondered if that was them and even stood out on my porch with my phone. No one got out and it just drove off after a few minutes so I assumed it was unrelated. I contact customer support to try and remedy this situation, even maybe compensate for the inconvenience this has caused me all day and all I get is a whoops sorry I’ll have to reschedule you later this afternoon there’s nothing I can do. What???? I have never been so dissatisfied or disappointed in a company in my life!
Excellent service and knowledgeable staff

comment: Device was replaced quickly and accurately.  Help call was scheduled in a timely manner.  Technicians were not as knowledgeable as I would have expected. We then had to have a second call because the transfer took a long time.  (Not their fault.)  Second technician showed a better, faster way to get everything done, but it took him a while to get on track.

titre: read the review if you want to know why 2 starts...
comment: here is the thing... I had to speak with 3 techs to get the job done, so the rating doesn't tell the whole story.1st tech made me take a device that had no cellular ability and hook it up to do a factory reset, which means a re-download of the OS.  As I work in an office, and not at home, gaining access to wifi meant I had to go home...So I went home, factory reset the phone, re-installed the OS, and tried to set the phone up.  It still wouldn't.2nd tech helped me try to trouble shoot the phone, but didn't understand that I couldn't get the iPhone past the Hello, Hola, etc screen.  She then  passed the buck when it became clear to her that she wasn't able to help me.  The problem there was, she just put me on hold, and didn't pass any of my info on to the next tech about my situation.3rd tech did a great job, worked to understand then summarily fix the problem.  She was the real star of the show and I wish I could remember her name so she could be recognized.  If I had gotten her instead of the 2nd tech, this would be a 4 or even 5 star review, that is how far the 1st and 2nd tech drug this experience down...Let me reiterate, the 1st and 2nd tech were awful...THE 3RD TECH WAS AWESOME, AMAZING, AND SOLVED THE PROBLEM!!!Thank you

comment: Worst customer experience ever. Filed a claim, tech called wrong phone number for 30 minute grace period and appointment was rescheduled following day. Rep disconnected after 30!minutes and did not call me back... and cancelled the claim without anyone’s consent. Called asurion back and was told I had to pay an additional fee for a new claim!! Spoke to a manager who was most unhelpful and decided the phone could now not be fixed. Confused?!! We were. The phone worked fine and could text, call, take pictures. So, now it would cost 150 instead of 29 to replace the entire phone and not just the screen.  Between talking to Verizon and Assurion , this nonsense took HOURS on the phone. Asurion is a total nightmare. Their reps are terrible

comment: The service was excellent and the shipping was so fast. When buying a phone people always think why buy insurance for a phone I'll just buy one when and if the phone breaks. This is the worst customer service I have experienced in a while. This company falsely advertises what services they provide, and make you jump through hoops to get anything done. We have two new iPhones under their policy and one of them was dropped and the screen broke. They offer same day repair, but this only applies to certain areas of the country. Of course our area is not listed, so they wanted us to send the phone in and wait 3 to 7 business days to get the screen fixed. We run a business out of that phone, and cannot be without it for more than a couple of hours. They offered to replace the phone, but then we would have to pay $200 for the replacement, when the deductible to fix the phone is only $29. We asked if we could get it fixed locally, and have them reimburse us for the cost of the repair and they declined that request. Very misleading, they don't keep their promises, and they are flat out dishonest and in my book that makes them liars and thieves.

titre: I sent my phone in to get a cracked…
comment: I sent my phone in to get a cracked screen fixed and was told the phone was beyond repair and had to get a  refurbished phone.  I received the replacement phone quickly and also received my broken phone back the same day.  Upon opening my original phone I noticed there was a lot more damage than the cracked screen and it must have happened during the shipment to fix the screen.  I called to report all this to Asurion and the first manager I spoke with was very rude and refused to refund me any money and told me I had to take it up with FedEx.  I immediately called FedEx and they told me that I couldn't file a claim because I was neither the sender or the receiver on the shipment (both were Asurion), and that they would have to file a claim on my behalf.  I called back again and this time I got an agent by the name of Stephanie.  She was amazing!! I told her the situation and she called FedEx to see what they could do.  Unfortunately what they needed wasnt something Asurion usually did but Stephanie was able to talk to someone and get me the additional money I had been charged for the refurbished phone refunded.  I was so furious with Asurion to start with and offended by the lack of customer service the first lady I spoke with gave me but Stephanie was a complete professional and so nice, and because of her and her customer service I once again have faith in Asurion, so thank you to everyone who helped me with a situation that was not my fault and making me a satisfied customer.
Wayyyyy too expensive! Not worth it.
Great service can not complain about this insurance.

titre: I lost my phone to a big boom wave in…
comment: I lost my phone to a big boom wave in Mexico..plunk, to the depths of the wild ocean. Alas, I had never used my Asurion insurance for 14 years ( a load of new phones worth!) but when I called from out of the country, they explained and took care of everything. I was lucky I had a friend's phone to call Asurion and Verizon from Mexico, and he had a plan to the US also. I asked many questions, such as: why can't you ship my new phone to Mexico? well, I hadn't paid for THAT coverage- out of country. I thought I was covered. So, I had to wait a week until I returned, but luckily I had use of my friend's phone for the next 4 days for taking pictures, and calling my taxi to get to the airport, etc. When I arrived in the US, I went straight to Verizon where I had arranged to have the new phone sent, and they helped me to set it all up. Thanks to using the i-cloud, I lost nothing! Just had to re-load my music. The co-pay was under $100, so reasonable. Moral of the story?  Check your plan closely/Get insurance to cover you international if you are trave/ing. Stay away from big waves. Get a phone case that holds the phone in securely. (I was left with the case, but the pone popped out- magnetic).

titre: Replacement phones are terrible, go with Apple Care
comment: My experience with Asurion has been terrible. My phone screen cracked and it had been a little glitchy anyway so I decided to use my insurance and get a replacement. I paid the deductible and got not one but two dud replacement devices that didn’t work. They definitely don’t send you a NEW phone, it appears to be refurbished. Finally I had enough and sent back both replacements and decided to keep my original and just fix the screen! I was told they would reimburse me for the deductible. I check back roughly a month later and guess who hadn’t received their refund? Contacted the company and they say it is coming now. Once I get me refund I will be cancelling my insurance and going with Apple Care. What is the point if the replacement devices are worse than the originals?

Absolutely ridiculous! I cannot believe Verizon partners with these guys. So I submit a claim on my cracked Galaxy s8+ and the next day receive the replacement. The replacement that was sent was a regular s8 not a plus. So I call them. I had to call four times in a row as the menu was only giving me the option to track. Finally I reached a live person and was told that "I selected the s8 instead of the +". I was told to get my s8+ I would have to cancel the claim and file a new one and that my refund would take ONE TO TWO BILLING CYCLES. That's 2 months!!! And I would now have to pay a larger deductable. So I'll be out $400 for a replacement because THEY sent me the wrong phone and cannot refund me for 2 months? Seriously??? I am seriously considering cancelling Verizon now too. This is borderline fraudulent. Even if I did select the wrong device as they say I did, their menu was EXTREMELY difficult to use and select anything at all, that's saying a lot as I work in IT myself. They act like they do not know what device is on my account. It's as if I could select Iphone X to replace my Galaxy and they would not care. Absolutely horrible experience. I advise against using them unless you like getting screwed and double charged.

That is not comfortable for me as I don’t like random people coming to my home. My service date was then scheduled 5 days from the date of the call and in a two hour time frame which requires me to be home longer and take more time off. I am so aggravated with this process and will be canceling any insurance related to Asurion after this.

comment: Once I spoke with a person, it was smooth. Trying to complete this process by email did not work well for me.

Cracked screen on Samsung 8+. Set up to have repaired at my house tech called and said it would be faster if he picked it up and carried to the shop and fix screen. Tech came to my house picked up phone and said he 'll have it back in 24 hrs. Got home from work it's morning and had and email stating it will be tomorrow afternoon before he returns it so that's 3 days without phone. Very unacceptable when tech know that is my only phone. Got on Facebook with tech support and they just have me the run around and no help from them. They told me to call the tech told them I have no phone their tech has it. Than they asked for email address and they would contact me by email no word from them. Very poor service. Will be getting insurance with another company if I ever get my phone back.

Our fridge broke and was reported to Asurion on July 5th. Today is August 21st. I have email confirmation that the refund check was to be delivered August 15th and I have called them 5 times today and they will not give me a tracking number.  A broken fridge in the middle of the summer for 45 days. I kid you not, I talked to at least 16 different supervisors and representatives throughout the 45 days.  I called them at least 50 times, and this is not an exaggeration.  Be ready to speak to a different person each time you call, with no resolution. Only one person was helpful in that bunch.  His name is Lyman.   If you want to wait for 45 days and waste 45 minutes each time you call, this is the company to work with.  Go ahead and purchase their services, but be warned, this is what you are getting.  Happy Shopping!

titre: Reporting my lost phone was easy
comment: Reporting my lost phone was easy.  I answered a few simple questions and had my new phone less than 24 hours later.  Then an associate helped me set up my new phone.

The replacement process was smooth, but only because of the Verizon employee.  I was traveling out of state when I lost the phone and had no access to a computer.  Had I made it to my destination, a rural town in Michigan, I would have had to drive 1 hour to the nearest store.  As it was, I was in the Detroit area and found a Verizon store where they allowed me to use their computer to submit the appropriate form.  If I had not been in Detroit, I would have borrowed a phone to call Asurion, but according to your policy, would not have been able to submit my claim verbally.  Your policy should allow for verbal submission of claims.

I am floored by the amazing response. My wife's iPhone was stolen. At 11AM on a Friday I went to the Asurion website to file a claim. The website was remarkably clear and easy to navigate, with easy-to-read and understand text and big buttons to click. I am computer-savvy, but even so I appreciate the site (go and figure out some banking sites, or store sites).So at 11AM Friday I entered my claim; will ship in 1-2 business days. Good enough: that means Monday or Tuesday, right? In fact, at 11AM Saturday I was accepting a package from FedEx. 24 hours!As it happens, that replacement phone had a defect that took us a couple days to notice. No problem: I called, and an immediate response. Replacement on its way, and again about 24hrs later we had the phone.Excellent service, they discounted the deductible 50% due to no prior claims, and cheaper than buying a new phone we don't need. These days being without a phone is a full-blown crisis. Back it up, and get this insurance.

The ONLY drawback was that I was unable to receive the exact duplicate of my Samsung Galaxy 7 Active (I LIKED having the physical buttons). Instead, I got an upgrade (which I am still getting things settled in and used to -- I know, waaah, waaah -- but as I said, I LIKED the physical buttons on the S7 Active)... I did have to purchase a different case, different screen 'glass protectors' which along with the co-pay of $112, kind of adds up...  BUT, I am thoroughly happy with the upgrade -- and I'll get used to the new features soon. I do like that the upgrade has a way to click for 'still' photo while recording a video!!! That's pretty handy! Thank you.

titre: Did a great job in replacing my phone…
comment: Did a great job in replacing my phone (refurbished of course) in a very short period of time. However, I was almost tempted to use my $200 deductible towards a band new phone. But, in the case, time was important. Had a replacement within 24 hours.

This was the worst company I have ever dealt with. I shattered my phone and went to verizon and set up a at home fix with them. After that, I was put through numerous ridiculous circumstances, first with the technician never showing up and never calling to let us know. I waited in my house for 8 hours in hopes they would come, and called asurion twice to only be told that they’re “sorry, the part is not available and they will send a new technician with the part”. The “new” technician never showed up, and then I was told that they don’t know when they would get my part (a seven plus screen) in- it could be within the week or more. It was absoutletly ridiculous. I PAY for this insurance to not have to worry if I break my phone. Instead, this company completely disregarded my concerns and left me with no idea on what to do with my phone. I ended up having to pay out of pocket to get it fixed somewhere else, since the crack couldn’t wait “more than a week” for the part to come in. The only good thing about Asurion is that they refunded me the rate of $30 that I had to initially pay to get my phone fixed. Besides that, it was the worst service I’ve ever dealt with from a company. DO NOT BY THIS INSURANCE. YOU WILL NOT GET YOUR PHONE FIXED.

titre: Not Good but Not Horrific Either...
comment: Not Good but Not Horrific Either...Although Asurion did end up getting me a replacement. It wasn’t with ease. When filing a claim trying to do from a mobile phone was difficult to navigate. Once my “Lost Phone/Stolen” claim was processed, they sent a new phone in a few days. I called to have them help set it up, but when they told me to insert a SIM card from my old phone (See Lost Claim Above) I ended up having to wait another 2 days for a Sim Card. Fortunately there was a nearby carrier store to buy immediately (additional $) a SIM Card as business was/is being conducted on my phone everyday. Attention to detail is critical, a simple phone sent with all required pieces to having it work out of the box would have netted 5 stars.

Asurion makes the hassle of replacing cell phones a whole lot better.   Insurance is a must when you have a cell phone.  With Asurion I feel good knowing that "if" I ever need to file a claim, my replacement phone will, usually, be in my hands by the next business day!  Thank you Asurion!!!

I was on hold for a long time, at one point someone didn't even let me finish what I was calling about and transferred me thinking they knew what I wanted.  (Hate when that happens). Once I got to the right person,  she gave me instructions to reset the phone. So I asked her "how's that going to get rid of the thin white line in the middle of the screen? ". Her response: oh there's a white line on the screen? Well aren't you listening to what I'm saying? She then said we're sending you a new replacement phone out today. We got the phone the next day.

titre: The process was quick and easy!
I consider this a scam company because…
comment: I consider this a scam company because nothing of value is offered in exchange for the premiums.  My phone broke, and I was offered an inferior and older model.  This model could be purchased from the manufacturer via Amazon for $135 while the deductible with Asurion was $225.  In addition, they do not pay off the balance owed on your old phone, as auto insurance would; you still have to pay it off, and to add insult to injury, you also have to send the old phone in to Asurion.  I am guessing they refurbish these phones to provide to other claimants, thus bringing the scam full circle.  In sum: when compared to having no insurance at all, with Asurant I would pay an extra $90 for the replacement phone, no longer have my old phone for backup etc, and will never recover my wasted premiums.

Website recommends to ship to an address other than your home and gives an option for suite, attn, etc. BUT FAILS TO ALLOW ME TO FILL THIS IN!!!! Then they demand a signed affidavit and photo ID BUT STILL FAILS TO ALLOW ME TO FILL THIS IN!!! What a joke. I need this phone replaced/repaired, I PAY GOOD MONEY FOR THIS INSURANCE, and I have to put up with this crap? This service/insurance is a complete rip-off. I'll be better off saving the money I spend on "premiums" and just getting the phone repaired somewhere that actually cares about customer service.

titre: Initially I first got a hold of the…
comment: Initially I first got a hold of the staff for my cell phone problems that I had on my Samsung S4. We were doing well on filing a claim for my first time. We ran into a problem when I couldn't find my IMEI number . The page that I was instructed to go to didn't have this on that page. I guess time was up for her as she gave me an 800 number or email address. I found that number by stumbling onto it and had hope she could bare with me or give a second instruction on where to find. So, I had gone thru another operator or agent of yours and found we could complete the claim but now the affidavit down load came into play in which I had to file it twice because what I didn't know is my husband was the primary name on the account. I wished that someone told me that in the first place because it would of saved time and frustration on my part. So, the new phone came and I turned the old one in back to you. The only problem that I had to that was my old phone turned off and on so much that neither the local AT&T person and myself could find a way for the phone to stay on long enough to transfer my personal info.so, the four star meant good but very frustrating with so much time on the house phone and my old phone clearance of personal information.

comment: The call center is a challenge, some of your staff werent highly trained or talented in people or communication.  But thanks to a few I was able to get adequate assistance.  The process of making a claim needs to be updated.  To not have online portal or mobile app to verify ID by upload, phone pic upload documents, or use digital fillable docs with esign, but instead require a print, wet sign and a fax is ridiculously outdated and to me suggest a deliberate attempt to make the process more difficult than it should be.  Being on vacation I had no printer or easy access to faxing.  I needed a replacement during my vacation, ended up getting a replacement after my 1 week vacation, which is unacceptable.

I think the technicians should have more than on replacement screen with them if they know they get bad screens and this leaves customers without working phones. A cracked screen may not look pretty, but it was still functioning when he got there.

titre: Customer service great, device selection lacking
comment: The customer service is great.  However, the options for the actual devices was disappointing.  My first claim was for a Galaxy S6 in gold.  The wifi stopped working altogether and after a repair attempt that was recommended by a Verizon rep, Verizon made good and set up the initial claim to have it replaced and gave me an upgrade to the S8.  This should have been exciting, but it was actually very, very disappointing to not be able to get my new phone in my preferred color.  I understand the model wasn't available, but I think attempts should be made to accommodate the customer's preferences when they are making a claim.  It turned out, also, that the newer model has a curved screen, which I did not like because it is SO MUCH MORE vulnerable to cracking.  Sure enough, I ordered my new case and had the phone for a week.  The day before the case arrived, the phone fell out of the car onto a driveway and cracked on every corner and hairline fractures appeared across the entire screen.  It became worse over the next few weeks, so I had to order another one; again, in black, not gold.  All in all, for the customer service, the actual representatives are helpful and friendly and the process is quick and easy.  It is the device options and selection I personally feel is lacking.  Still wish I could have my original phone in the color of my choice, but working!
Excellent Customer Service! Thank you Asurion!

I've been paying for insurance with Asurion now for something like three years I've never once used it. The one time I needed it, I was expected to pay a $200 deductible... On an $800 phone...  There needs to be a pool or a maximum amount that you pay in, and it needs to be capped off at some point.. Asurion has made a fortune off of me and I am strongly considering cancelling the membership because I don't feel that it's worth it.  I can understand due to the expensive cost of an automobile why automobile insurance is needed.But if this company is going to charge me $200 if I accidentally cracked my screen and need it repaired or replaced I may as well just buy another phone.

I think the process could be a bit faster (as someone with a lot of tech savvy seemed to struggle some so I know it would have been worse for me), but overall I was satisfied with the experience.  I've been paying the insurance for 9 years every month and then had to pay a $112 deductible so overall I don't think the value was great but it saved me from having to buy a brand new phone so that was satisfying.  I think it would be ideal for the deductible to decrease over the years if you haven't used it.

titre: We contacted the company for a new…
comment: We contacted the company for a new phone due to damaging a new phone thru Verizon. We paid the deductible and received phone a day later. Just over a month later the phone started to act up. We contacted them again and they started due to being over a month we would have to pay again. We reluctantly paid a second time and waited for the phone. Week later no phone came.We contact them again and they stated that if was a shipping error and they would have to restart the order. After being put on hold several times, 10 min at a time they stated they needed our card to order. We were then transferred to supervisor because we were not paying again. They had already taken out the deductible already and never received a phone. After waiting again for 10 minutes just to get the supervisor, she ordered the handset. I have had decent service in the past but this last time was ridiculous. 45 minutes call just to get them to send a phone they already charged. Horrible customer service.
I received a replacement phone the very next day.  Very happy to get my phone replaced so quickly.

titre: Given the unique circumstances to my…
comment: Given the unique circumstances to my technical issue I had with my phone. I was satisfied when my phone was finally replaced. But the process to get to customer solutions was not easy. After paying for and having an appointment with a technician that fixed one problem which was the glass over the screen but possibly created another where the phone was no longer able to charge. Being told to pay another 180$ for a replacement phone was not appropriate. When paying 12$/month for insurance on a phone for 2 years you end up paying 288$. I guess given the option to either pay 180$ to have a phone sent to me or not have a phone for possibly 5 business days to send my phone in to be fixed was not really fair. I cant think of any person who uses their phone for business could go 5 days without their phone. I can understand if someone makes multiple claims on the same phone needing more of a copay to replace but I've been with Verizon for 6 years. Thank you for making customer solutions as effective as it is. After a week of phone calls was solved by a 3 minute conversation.  Thank you to all the people who listened to me talk about what happened over and over.

i filled my claim on 26th june 2018, first they told me that i will get a interview call from them regarding my lost i phone, i waited for a week but i got no call from them, then they gave me the number for the third party company that makes interview call for asurion . On calling them they told me that they stopped working for Asurion. when i called the asurion customer service they told me that ok, your phone will be shipped tomorrow just after updating your documents, after 48 hours when i again called them they told me to upload one more photo id. again after 48 hours , they said they got the same id again , on transferring the call to supervisor , he said  they have got the two ids and they will review it in another 24-48 hours. but even after 48 hours they keep on saying the same excuse to wait for another 48 hours . and today is 23rd July 2018 and i am still waiting for the awaiting review for my documents and  have no idea how many more days it will take to receive my phone.TOTALLY FRUSTRATING ....explain everyday ,same story to the customer service, NO PROFESSIONALISM..they just keep on transferring call from one department to other.and even after writing a negative review here, they dont care.they called me , but giving same lame excuses again and again.They have no respect for customers. Its more than a month and i am still struggling now i have to file a complaint about them in CCTS.

titre: Becoming widowed gave Asurion a loophole to deny my claim.
comment: I paid insurance on my son's phone starting in September 2016. My husband, who was the primary account holder, passed away in January 2017. When my son broke his phone in June of 2018 Asurion would not let me submit the affidavit because I was not the primary account holder. At that time I was required to create a new account as the primary account holder. Then when I submitted the affidavit, they said the previous account no longer existed, kept the 20 months of insurance payments and charged me the full deductible. I asked for managers and supervisors.  I talked to 3 different people all the way up to a representative from CEO Tony Vetter's office. They refused to help. They pocketed the money from a widow and her two sons. I am outraged! I know it's not a lot of money, but it's a promise this company made that I paid into faithfully for two-and-a-half years. When I made the claim I was denied because I was widowed. The company showed no humanity, simply hid behind paperwork and policy. It is unfathomable!

titre: Some good, some bad- just like jelly beans.
comment: My feelings are a little mixed in regards to my experience with Asurion. My first impression was pretty negative when I called and was essentially forced to register my claim with an automated service. Some of the questions I would have liked to clarify with a person before answering. Also, I had to try twice because during the first time the service stopped recognizing my button presses. When I was finally allowed to speak to a live person, I had to answer random personal questions about myself in order to prove my identity which I actually found rather disquieting. There should have been sufficient information available without having to dig into my personal information or my past, especially since I am arranging for the repair/replacement of my mother’s phone. By the way, she probably would’ve given up on the automated service; not being technically savvy and dealing with that would’ve been too much for her. The representative was very civil, but possibly not as helpful since I had to discuss things more than once in effort to convey my thoughts. I was also dismayed that I would be facing a charge for replacement even though the problem with the phone was not my mother’s fault. I feel like I already paid by paying for the insurance plan. AT&T never said I would pay anything extra- not when I signed up and not when I had this problem. Furthermore, the Asurion representative never asked about repair; he just treated the situation automatically as if this was the only available option. I don’t know if it was or not, but I wonder if it could have been free under repair or cost less. I only want to have a usable phone til fall when Apple releases its new versions, which I did mention. If I am due for upgrading my phones, why would I spend a lot for something I won’t be keeping for much longer? The answer is: I wouldn’t. Also, I was asked if I wanted a free car charger or earbuds and I was sent the charger even though I had specified the earbuds- not that I really wanted either. Even though the service was civil and expedient, I can’t say that I was really satisfied. I already know Apple would have charged more for something out of warranty, but it is hardly a consolation.

Received my replacement phone in a timely fashion, the help when I called Asurion was above the customer service I usually get from any other company. the only issue was that I should have done more research of my own, fixing the phone would have been cheaper than paying the deductible to the insurance company.

Submitting a claim was easy, delivery times were met, and the activation process for the new phone not too difficult. The technician who helped with the activation was clear in her instructions, easy to understand, and patient. The entire activation process took less than 30 minutes and that included time spent downloading a transfer app needed to complete activation. The instructions and packaging for returning my damaged phone were, again, easy to follow. Now for why only 4 stars and not 5. A few days after putting the phone in the mailbox, I entered the USPS tracking number to get status. The message I received that day, and subsequent days, said the label was created but no package had yet been received. I called to see if it had been received or how I would know when it was received. It took about 10 minutes before someone told me I would receive an email once it was received and it should take 5-7 business days (it was about 10). I didn't see any of this information when I was filing the claim nor in the return instructions. Overall, the process far exceeded my expectations.

titre: Asurion seemed to do all they could to…
comment: Asurion seemed to do all they could to deny my claim. I was using a spare phone of my sister's and they couldn't seem  to understand that I was making a claim on my water damaged and dead phone. It took a conference call (or two - I can't remember anymore) with Verizon to try to get that straightened out. Then each time I thought I had it straightened out and resubmitted my claim, they denied it (3x total). They neglected to tell me that each re-submission required a new claim number. It took another conference call with Verizon to determine that. They finally approved the claim and sent the new phone. I used their set-up tech support to set it up and try to get my non-working iPhone off the Find My iPhone. However, since it was offline, the tech person could not figure out what I needed to do and had me put it on a setting that said when the phone was turned on all would be erased. I thought all was taken care of but no.... a few days later Asurion e-mailed me and said they would charge a $500.00 charge because I had not taken my phone off the 'find my iPhone' app. I called them and explained what had happened. They told me to call Apple to figure it out. Apple was able to help me erase the phone and I have not heard back from Asurion so I assume all is well. It was a LOT of time and aggravation!

I went to Apple first to diagnose my phone and I could have walked away with a new phone for $50 more had I used their insurance. I won’t be buying this insurance again based on having to wait a few days. Also I think it’s ridiculous having to print and download paperwork to sign and send back. It’s not convenient. Should be DocuSign, easy to do.

titre: I’m writing a review to say how…I’m irritated by bad service
comment: I’m writing a review to say how frustrated I am with this company. I have had cell phones and insurance with this company for years I never had to use them except once in the past about 4 years ago. To replace a phone and then recently my daughter broke her phone and needed a complete replacement. And then a few days later my phone cracked so literally back to back phone issues this happened in June my daughters phone came right away mine on other had just needed a screen replaced it’s now July 8th and have had a weekly call for over 40- 60 mins each time trying to figure what the problem is. Today I was hung up on while on hold. I get the run around like people just want to pass My issue over, finally today a supervisor found the issue they, had me down as not having insurance which I do I have a family plan so they also had to call Verizon and confirm which Verizon confirmed I am insured. And after all this the lady says sorry we can’t just fix the screen the computer is not allowing her to they want me to get a new phone of course they do the deductible for crack screen is $29 and the phone replacement is $150. So I told after countless calls and them not fixing the issue this should not be happening it’s just BS that they already took the $29 from my checking account but could not do the repair so now my claim is open but who knows when I’ll have the issue fixed. Also they could have fixed the screen the other day but now they don’t know why but computer is not letting her put in a repair order.  So unprofessional I’m paying for a service !!!!!! But not getting anything in return

titre: Wish I could give NO stars!
comment: I'm am extremely disappointed in this Company. I placed my claim on 07/06 selecting Saturday shippings, Promising me the next day delivery (07/07). Early saturday morning I checked my claim number online, saying I would receive it that day but it wasn't providing me a shipping number, I proceeded to call the customer service number and check on the status. The automated line said it had been shipped... at about 7pm I because flustered after waiting all day for the phone and called again. I now selected to speak to an agent. Once on the line with the agent, I was on hold for 45 minutes while she checked the status of my order; then returning to the line to tell me there was a system error and my device was never sent out. I asked to speak to a supervisor and was placed on hold again until the supervisor was ready, which was no use because she told me that all she could do was expedite the shipping to get here on monday! (HOW IS THAT EXPEDITED IF IT WAS SUPPOSED TO GET HERE TODAY?!...) She then said she could compensate me with a $25 visa gift card that would take about 4 weeks to get here. Completely ridiculous, its unfortunate this is the insurance my phone company uses, and i'm now forced to use it. (Not to mention I asked if the phone will be new or refurbished and she said "either, or". I pay $13 monthly and a $200 deductible to receive a possibly refurbished phone.)

titre: I was able to get the parts for my…
comment: I was able to get the parts for my truck quickly and affordabily with. This company. I say it’s wonderful.

Asurion handled my Wal-mart phone replacement. The device malfunctioned on a Tuesday. On Wednesday I shipped off my old device at 9 am. By noon my Wal-mart online claim status said my replacement had been shipped. As of Thursday the NEXT week I still had not received my device. I reached out through the chat option online (which took two attempts before someone answered) and was told my phone was on back-order, the replacement should be arriving at their site the next day, it would be shipped to me on Monday, and I would receive an email when it shipped. On Monday I had received no email, so I used the chat support again. I was told the device would be shipped Tuesday. Today is Tuesday, and I had not received an email yet, so I contacted support again. The agent, Karla (who had been my agent every time I contacted them) gave me a tracking number and told me my device had shipped. The UPS website says that the package associated with that number has not reached their facility yet, but the label has been printed. Tomorrow is a holiday, so I will likely have to wait until Thursday for the package to even reach the UPS facility. [Update, the UPS website now says the package is in their delivery network.] I also received an email from Wal-mart saying my package has shipped, but the tracking number was for the product I sent them, not the one they sent me. Luckily I still have the tracking number the agent gave me in the chat. All in all, I'm very disappointed in my experience with Asurion so far. I would have felt much better if I had been told sooner, and without having to reach out to customer service first, that my phone was on back-order. Additionally, the fact that I can only contact customer support through a chat function is very inconvenient. I hope I receive my phone soon, as I have been without one for two weeks now.

The worst warranty company ever. I have paid premiums for 3 years on multiple phones through Verizon and they treat me terribly and have unnecessarily delayed my claim for a phone replacement. Only go with them if you are willing to wait 7 days to get a replacement phone!! Terrible!!

titre: If I could give less than one star I would
comment: Filed an insurance claim because there was a problem with the battery on my phone but had to pay $150 for the replacement device because the screen is cracked as well. The phone they sent me is completely broken and did not work from the second I got it. I didn't even get to use it or activate it and they even admitted they were able to see that it wasn't activated on my account. The home button doesn't work, the phone itself is extremely and unusually slow, and the sim tray wouldn't come out. I brought it to Verizon and they couldn't even fix it or get the tray out and told me to go to an iPhone fix it store to see what was actually wrong with it. They told me that this company basically sends out refurbished phones but the problem with that is that most of the parts in my phone aren't even from apple. They said that this company sends out the lowest quality of iphones that may not work and Apple told me the same thing. The iPhone fix it place said they didn't want to rip me off and that its best that I request a new phone from Asurion because it was evident they sent me a device that doesn't even work and I wasn't at fault for anything. After being left on hold for 10+ minutes multiple times and being transferred to 6 different people who all told me that I had to file a NEW CLAIM AND PAY THEM ANOTHER $150 because the sim tray wouldn't come out and that it counts as "physical damage"... that's BS ASURION IS NOTHING BUT A BUNCH OF SCAMMERS... EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL.  I reached a man named Jeffery who was extremely rude. This man would not let me talk and screamed over me. Overall, by far the rudest, most unhelpful, scamming, unprofessional customer service I have ever dealt with in my life. Why pay for insurance when all they're going to do is send you a phone more broken than the one you needed replaced and then demand another $150 for them to actually do their job and send a working phone?

Customer service, warranty dept are not service oriented at all.  I had received my replacement phone, but it came in with a scratch on the back. When I go to get another replacement phone and it is just the cracked screen, then $30, but if they try to tell me that I SCRATCHED THE BACK and want 150, the I WILL RAISE HOLY HELL. I asked them for a screen shot of their comments in the data base to be assured that they noted the scratched back, but they tell me they are not capable of taking a screen shot even, much less sending me some documentation that the issue on this new phone was noted.   Then I spent several hours with their phone help only to have to go back to VZ to get activation, despite the activation message that stated to call Ashurion.  VZ finally got the issue cleared up.   Believe me, I would pay more for a better service approach.  The last CSR at Assyouron stated that the only way they could help me was to get back to default, which meant that all the contacts that had previously come in from the cloud were wiped out.  I have 7000, plus lots of text, so all that time getting that info was lost.  I asked the CSR that told me to set to default to stay on the line with me after she said I needed to wait for 30 minutes to see if the phone would set up.  She said she would not because she could not afford to be on the call that long.  Never mind how long I was without my business contacts, several hours.  The attitude was not customer centric, despite I do not know how many times they called me MIss Michele.  How irritating!  I gave them one star for having the obviously missed by QA phone arrive on time. That is when the party started.

The first level of customer service was not able to find out why the phone was not holding a charge at this point we were transferred to a Tech. Long story short My tech Joan was very helpful and walked me through the process of updating several things on the phone before it would hold the charge.Mrs. Valencia

This was great. I am an EA and all of our CEO's calls forward to my cell. I lost my phone on Friday night and had a new one Monday afternoon! Great, quick and a good price for a new phone. Thank you!

titre: I cracked the glass on my phone Friday…
comment: I cracked the glass on my phone Friday while making dinner.  At 6:30pm I filed a claim at my local AT&T store.  My replacement phone arrived before noon on Saturday.  I could have asked for better service.  Definitely worth the $8.99/month.  Thank you for the great service.
Thank you, everything was great.

They rescheduled my initial appointment (to replace my cracked screen) because the part was not in stock. When they failed to show up for the second appointment, I called and was told they never stock that particular part and repair is not an option. After unnecessarily waiting several weeks, I had to ship my phone back for replacement.

titre: Horrible experience and that's on Att…
comment: Horrible experience and that's on Att and Asurion. I had to back 2 trips to a repair place that in the end was NOT covered my Asurion as a place I could get my phone fixed, but att and 2 Asurion reps sent me there. I had to speak with 5 reps and a Manager which all told me different things, then after all that I could let get my phone repaired. I had no other choice but to get a new phone because the only authorized  repair ppl were over an hour away from me. My phone was brand new already. It just had a crack on the side. Just horrible!!!

Had to go through almost the whole process to get my deductible amount. Fairly straight forward on the phone. I finished the claim online. Very surprised by shipping, submitted and approved on Friday evening and was delivered sat by 11am. The return process was easy enough. iPhone wouldn’t turn on so had a nightmare trying to erase but that’s Apple for you
I am satisfied, Burgos I hace a complain because The celular that I received have a chip or significativas that maybe failed to Theron floor.

Filing the claim was very easy & prompt! Even mailing back my old phone was extremely easy.Thank you so much! I highly recommend Asurion to anyone.
No problem exchange. Fast delivery and processing.

My daughter’s new phone was shut off. There was no reason for it, so she went into our carrier store. They found that someone had reported her phone stolen and filed a claim with asurion the morning prior and was delivered this morning. My daughter had her phone with her, and the employees in the store identified it as hers.  Clearly the claim filed was fraudulent and the new phone obviously wasn’t delivered to our address on file. Asurion didn’t bother to contact us regarding the claim, yet replaced it in less than 24 hours. When it was reported, they told us that they would shut off the fraudulent phone, but my daughter’s phone wouldn’t be turned back on for TEN days!!! Seriously? Asurion accepts a fraudulent claim, and the criminal got a brand new phone in the mail and turned on in 24 hours, but the victim has to wait TEN days to have her phone turned back on??!!! Wow. We’ve been loyal customers for more than 12 years. If I could give less than one star, I would. Avoid this “insurance company” at all costs.

over all great. didn't have any trouble, it arrived on time like they said it wouldthe phone call went well ... didn't give may any hassle over the phone- after I explained what was happening to the phonethanks Asurion

This company is terrible. I have an Samsung Galaxy S8+ which has the IP68 rating indicates that the Galaxy S8 and S8+ is water resistant up to 1.5 meters (4.92 feet) for 30 minutes. So just a fair warning to everyone after you pay the high deductible. You no longer have that feature my phone was splashed on, not submerged under water. The front camera lenses got foggy. I called and asurion and they refused to replace it after just a splash. So apparently they send half repaired phones to customers because it could not resist a water splash while the Samsung S8 can be under water for up to 30mins with ease. I would rather pay the full mspr of the phone next time then dealing with a company that takes your money and sends to a crap phone back.

titre: Professionalism, Knowledge and Suggested Implementation of Deductions
comment: Although the professionalism and expert knowledge was exemplary, I believe your rate of usage and subscriptions will increase if you would reduce your deductions that are exorbently high. You should consider a scaling rate for deductions, i.e. staring at a reduced amount and increase each time the insurance is utilized only on the same model of cell phone. Once a model is upgraded by a purchaser, then the reduced rate of deductions would be reinstated and then again increased, only on an upgraded model...

It was okay. I think it's kind of ridiculous that each individual account with this pays on average $13 per device per month & then if you ever have to submit a claim, you pay another pricey deductible to get back a refurbished phone. I mean my account alone has paid $234 to insurance in the last 6 months, then had to pay an $29 deductible to get a REFURBISHED phone. That adds up to $263 dollars for insurance & one refurbished phone. When I could have not paid for insurance for those 6 months & bought a NEW phone with the money I would have saved. It did arrive overnight...but like I said you could purchase a new phone for the price of one insurance claim. Seems a little backwards to me, maybe if you placed a claim every 3 months or something, but your still paying for a refurbished phone. Other than that, it was great. Thanks.

Turned in a claim. Paid $89.95 deductible.  Asurion sent me a used phone put together from used parts. Could not get it to work properly. After 2 weeks of fighting with the replacement phone I took it to an Apple store and they informed me the battery failed their test and would not hold a charge.I Called Asurion to ask to return the phone and for them to refund my $89.95. After arguing with 2 people they refused. I was informed they would send me another replacement phone. I argued that they did not confirm that the first phone should not have been sent in the first place as it was a used junk phone not much better than the one I sent in for replacement. I opted out of another phone to avoid any further hassle with junk phones. I then called my provider and canceled my insurance. Not worth the money or hassle. Buyer beware!!!

titre: Talk about a scam ASURION "Protection Plans"
comment: Talk about a scam! These guys are the reason Protection Plans have such a bad name.  They make you jump through hoop after hoop in hopes you will just become exhausted and give up.  Now day 28 since the covered refrigerator quit working.   5 scheduled repair visits with no results.  Next step?  Schedule a 6th repair visit.  No thanks!  They do not replace until THEY "determine that we cannot service your product".  But they told me there is no time limit or maximum number of visits they can use before making this determination.  A month without a refrigerator is way too long for me - but not for them.  Avoid Asurion protection plans (offered by Home Depot and elsewhere I presume).  They took $250 up front and provided nothing but hassle and aggravation.UPDATE:  Looks like they have PR robot response to online reviews. I believe it's nothing but window dressing.  But I did respond to the email provided and will update if they actually do anything. The 3 other contacts provided previously have provided no answers.  I will update this with a link for others who want to join in our action against Asurion and Home Depot.
Great service, but deductibles are way too large.

We have had over heating, broken, shattered phones and even just not holding a charge any longer.   They have always been there for us and replaced our devices.  The technical support side has always been helpful!  I would highly recommend this coverage!!

titre: Asurion cancels during the repair window... twice
comment: I took time off work to schedule a repair and in the middle of the 2 hour repair window they called me and said they didn’t have device parts for the repair. So they made me reschedule, which was upsetting because my bosses weren’t happy about me taking time off work in the first place. So I had to live with a broken phone for another week until they could come to repair it. Then the morning of the repair, in the middle of the repair window, I got a call saying the technician was late and that he wouldn’t arrive until the end of the window. So that means more time off work for me, due to a late repair. But then as I sat there, the repair window ended and no techician showed up at all. So now I’m at a loss for hundreds of dollars from work and STILL walking around with a broken phone. Asurion is ridiculously disrespectful of my time.Edit: I called to follow up and they weren't helpful. I ended up asking for a refund. I also asked about a refund on the insurance itself but they haven't written back to me. I doubt they'll do that even though their company has just cost me a lot of time and money and hasn't repaired anything.

Not so with Asurion, apparently.  They honored the policy and came through with a quick replacement.  Yay!

titre: A very positive and helpful experience.
comment: I have had a cell phone since 2001 with different companies. At first I didn't get protection but as the price of phones increased I decided to get it. I have never had to use it - until now. I have a friend on the acct. The battery on her phone swelled up so much it broke the battery case to the outside. It still worked but was afraid it would blow up.With the protection I able to replace it. The  Verizon store people helped me with it. When I contacted Asurion you were so helpful and explained things so I didn't feel like it was my fault and I felt like you really cared. It was a very easy and positive experience. I have already told people about my positive experience. I hope this can help others realize that protection can save a lot of money and what a great experience I had with your company.
